Welcome to #jen-journey-rp! This is the start of the #jen-journey-rp channel.
Jennifer [Ssra¬π‚Å∞] | [Alnak‚Å∑] -8 26-03-2023 16:37
Begin: The Hidden Cave
Narrator BOT 29-03-2023 09:34
*Six adventurers all alike in purpose. In misty Barovia where we lay our scene. Where the blood moon makes the streets unclean, fatal monsters roam the streets. This is where the party meets. Ready to face what lies ahead, together they ford ahead. To the Burgomaster's shed they tread, hoping not to join the dead.* (edited)
Tavoros BOT 29-03-2023 10:00
A slight, young-looking Eladrin stands under the eaves of a building, keeping a lookout for the other adventurers he was told to meet here whilst trying to stay out of the blood rain. He leans back against his pack, over which a dark-wood longbow is slung and a strange mechanical contraption is strapped to the side. He wears a dark green cloak over a well-fitted shirt, tight trousers, and some armour, and he has gently tanned skin, brown mid-length hair and hazel eyes (though anyone familiar with Eladrin would know this can change with their seasonal form). He plays with his bracers while he waits, adjusting them so they feel more comfortable on his wrist. A rapier is sheathed in his belt, as are two daggers as well as soft, drawstring bag, which is attached but accessible at his waist. He smiles and hums a comforting tune to himself as he waits, to remind him of a time when he was warm and dry. He hasn't had such a feeling since arriving in Borovia, and, particularly in his Autumn form, he longs to be comfortable with a hearty meal and some fine wine or mead. 'Nevermind, I didn't come for comfort.' he has to tell himself to keep his spirits high.
Laurentina BOT 29-03-2023 13:56
the sister finally returned from her harrowing visit to a strange rocky environment full of squid-gnomes. Her expression was still light and hopeful a strange sight in this plane. She had all this gold now, more than she ever had and wasn't sure what to really do with it. she pondered lost in thought as she found herself in front of the burgomaster's residence
Liliana BOT 29-03-2023 14:00
Well... it has been a while, hasn't it? At least finally Liliana is going to see some action, however much or little it may be. Walking through the streets of Barovia, with only her purple eyes peering out from under the hood she spots the lone Eladrin as well as the other woman. Must be the place, last time it was a small gathering of people that led her to the right spot as well...
Orion BOT 29-03-2023 14:02
I make my way along with the party, a small thri-kreen with a platinum yellow carapace, a light crossbow held in my smaller hands, the bigger pair of hands are empty. I carry a backpack filled with supplies, and a battering ram strapped to it. A sturdy looking cloak flows around me, partially covering my gear, and myself. [Telepathic to all] " Greetings, for those I do not know, I am Orion. For those I do know, it is a pleasure to see you again."
Narrator BOT 29-03-2023 14:05
Pools of blood from the thick blood rain can be seen in the streets glistening in the moonlight.
Tavoros BOT 29-03-2023 14:07
"Oh hey Orion, nice to see you're coming along too." he says to the thri-keen. Turning to the other two, he adds "I'm Tavoros by the way, really nice to meet you!" He says this with a good amount of enthusiasm and a smile, so much so that a cynic might question whether is he actually genuine.
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 29-03-2023 14:08
looks around hearing a strange voice in her head expression panicked
Orion BOT 29-03-2023 14:10
seeing the ladies panicked look, I wave and reach out again, [tele] "Do not fear. It is only I, Orion. My people are unable to speak in the common tongue, and so we adapted by learning telepathy to be able to communicate with others not of our kind."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 29-03-2023 14:10
*Igrim arrived a few later and looked over the entire group. As usual, he was clad in a dark grey cloak with edges stained with crimson blood. On his shoulder was a spaulder with an unfamiliar emblem. Slung over his shoulder was an old bow, clearly seen some use but somehow still looking usable.* "Hello." The telepathy no longer surprised him, he's just accepted that everything was going to surprise him so he might as well not care.
Liliana BOT 29-03-2023 14:10
"Liliana." She does not quite seem to be in the chattiest of moods. At least not with all that blood around them not-too-gently reminding her that she had been on something of a diet recently "I don't suppose any of you know what exactly we will be walking into here?"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 29-03-2023 14:12
"No idea. All I know is that we're supposed to explore a cave that, so far, has been uncharted." He said nonchalantly while he stared at the pools of blood.
Orion BOT 29-03-2023 14:13
[tele] "I have no idea what I'm doing here. I just went to where the posting said to go. Figured I would figure it out when I got there."
Orion BOT 29-03-2023 14:14
the thri-kreen is as genuine as he is clueless.
Narrator BOT 29-03-2023 14:18
As the group gets better aquainted on the walk to the Burgomaster's house they reach the door in front of the house taking shelter under the awning.
Tavoros BOT 29-03-2023 14:22
"Are we all here? I was told there would be 6 of us? Maybe they'll meet us here?"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 29-03-2023 14:23
"They'll catch up, I'm sure." Igrim sighed and closed his eyes, remembering his past experiences with Ismark before stepping forward and knocking on the door. "Lord Burgomaster!" He called out.
Narrator BOT 29-03-2023 14:26
Pitter patter pitter patter goes the rain on the awning to the house as Igrim calls out to the Burgomaster. Shuffling can be heard inside before the door opens to the residence.
Ismark Kolyanovich BOT 29-03-2023 14:26
"Do come in won't you. I appreciate your visit in this frightful time. Come get out of that rain."
Orion BOT 29-03-2023 14:27

Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 29-03-2023 14:30

Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 29-03-2023 14:31
she bows politely "I-i am Sister L-Laurentina pleased to meet you"
Ismark Kolyanovich BOT 29-03-2023 14:34
"Welcome Sister Laurentina. Welcome all. I hate to request an expedition with the current issues we are having but it may be time sensitive and I fear it might be related to the moon. I can not be sure but that is why this expedition is so important!"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 29-03-2023 14:38
At the mention of the moon, Igrim clenches his jaw and looks at Laurentina as he remembers her from the last mission he went on. "Of course it is. How were you able to tell it's related to the moon?" (edited)
Ismark Kolyanovich BOT 29-03-2023 14:41
"As you know, Barovia isn't a large place we do have scouts who are quite familiar with the land. One such scout reported to me in this message you see here." Gets out a piece of parchment offering it to Igrim.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 29-03-2023 14:42
Igrim took the parchment and held it out for everyone to read.
Narrator BOT 29-03-2023 14:48
"As you look at the page stained with blood you can make out the following text,
Burgomaster Kolyanovich, I regret to inform you we have seen the most frightful thing. As the blood moon rose the light shown on a trail in the mountains that became visible with the light of the moon. We went to investigate this new trail, and we were waylayed. I alone bairly managed to escape. I am sending this letter back in hopes my horse will find you. I am afraid I do not have much time left my wounds are great. The trail lead to a opening in the mountain well hidden in tbe foliage. Near Tser Lake. I recommend sending a team to investigate it. It has been an honor to serve you. - Fredrik
Liliana BOT 29-03-2023 14:49
"Well, that's related all right..."
Tavoros BOT 29-03-2023 14:53
"I'm sorry Mr Burgomaster sir, but was this Fredrik found with his horse? As in, did the horse ride back with him dead, or did he send the horse on without him?"
Ismark Kolyanovich BOT 29-03-2023 14:54
"Fredrik was a dear friend and excellent scout. He was one of a team of three. Only his horse returned with this note in his saddlebags. I know not what became of my friend."
Ismark Kolyanovich BOT 29-03-2023 14:57
"That letter is all I have to go on. You now know what I do. Tser lake is at the base of the mountain. Follow the river past the pools and falls. The river stops at the lake. You will have to find the trail he was referring to. I am afraid I do not have anymore information."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 29-03-2023 15:00
"I see." Igrim closed his eyes to commit the directions to memory before opening them back up and nodding. "As long as we find the general area, we should be able to find the trail and the cave."
Ismark Kolyanovich BOT 29-03-2023 15:02
"Please if you do find poor Fredrik give him a proper burial. He deserves to be in the wilds he loved to explore."
Tavoros BOT 29-03-2023 15:15
"We'll do our best for him if we find him." Tavoros replies with a gentle smile.
Ismark Kolyanovich BOT 29-03-2023 15:37
"You have my gratitude. Do you have all the supplies you need? You should be on your way there is no telling what you will find out there."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 29-03-2023 15:42
Igrim nodded and rubbed his neck. "Yes, we should get going if this truly is time sensitive." He turned around and faced his companions. "Shall we?"
Tavoros BOT 29-03-2023 15:50
"Aye, when our 6th gets here, let's get going."
Orion BOT 29-03-2023 16:00
nods in agreement

Io BOT 29-03-2023 19:43
Enter Io _Io knocks on the door, embarrassed about how late she is. The blood moon is a bad omen to her, and she had tried to alter her route to be in view as little as possible._
Ismark Kolyanovich BOT 29-03-2023 20:01
"That must be your other companion." Moves to the door and opens it. "Hello hello, please do come in and join your companions."
Io BOT 29-03-2023 20:42
_Io walks in, and everyone sees a very pale, very tall, 7 feet, and very thin woman enter. She looks as though someone took a normal person and stretched them out. She looks to the rest of the party._ "I appologize for being late. I hope I did not miss much?"
Tavoros BOT 29-03-2023 20:51
Completely flustered by the height of Io, Tavoros takes a few moments to compose himself, before responding. "Not at all, you are just on time, we were about to head out!"
Orion BOT 29-03-2023 20:57
stares up at the thin, tall woman [tele] "hello. I am Orion. What's your name? All you missed was the exchanging of pleasantries."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 29-03-2023 22:27
"Indeed. Now that we're all here, shall we move?" He slicks his hair back a little and pulls his hood up.
Narrator BOT 29-03-2023 23:54
*The party collects their things say their farewells to the Burgomaster and moves on following the red Tser river. They continue past the pools once at the falls they are stopped by the steepness of the fall. Will they climb down or go around?*
Orion BOT 30-03-2023 01:49
looks at the long fall down. [Tele] "I think ill take the long way down. Im not a fan of getting squished."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 30-03-2023 01:56
Igrim leaned towards the drop and looked to the water to see if there was anything waiting for them underwater. "The water seems safe enough."
Io BOT 30-03-2023 02:38

Orion BOT 30-03-2023 03:03

"I've fallen farther, we'll be fine." Igrim started to scale the way down, hopping from rock to rock.

As Igrim takes his first leap onto the rock he slips on the wet rock tumbling down to the bottom of the falls.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 30-03-2023 03:16
Once Igrim reached the bottom, he got back up and slotted his shoulder back in witha popping sound. "Ouch."
Io BOT 30-03-2023 03:20
_Io sees Igrim lose his grip, and in the interest of not leaving one of her allies alone, she jumps down after him. It's a skillful leap, and as she approaches the ground below, she starts to decelerate, as if gravity is affecting her differently than everyone else. She slowly, and safely, floats her way down until she touches down._ "Art thou alright?" _She asks Igrim._
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 30-03-2023 03:22

Orion BOT 30-03-2023 12:33

Liliana BOT 30-03-2023 12:34

Narrator BOT 30-03-2023 12:40
*The shipwright makes quick secure knots that easily allows them to climb down the falls. Liliana and Laurentina release the rope allowing for it to be recovered before calmly walking down the falls as if no harder to navigate than the ground. Once they are regrouped back together they continue following the river until they reach the lake as promised. Strangely they did not encounter any blood creatures on their path. The river and lake now red from the blood rain.* (edited)

Narrator BOT 30-03-2023 14:42
As you travel southwest following the river, you pass through brooding pine forests and deep vales. From where you stand now, you catch sight of a tall, steep hill that rises to a prominent mount Ghakis. A thin spire of smoke rises from some unseen point high on the mountain‚Äôs slopes. Igrim and Tavros can make out a steep, narrow road or track that runs back and forth across the face of the mountainside despite all the red blood. (edited)
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 30-03-2023 14:44
"There. That must be the trail mentioned in the letter." Igrim pulled his bow off of his back and held it just in case. "And there's also smoke... a campfire maybe?"
Liliana BOT 30-03-2023 14:45

Narrator BOT 30-03-2023 15:00
The group follows the smoke rising from the ground they do not spot a campfire. The smoke seems to be coming from underground but they are unable to pinpoint exactly where it originates as it is spread across the ground.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 30-03-2023 15:02
Igrim sighs and looks to Liliana. "Definitely a trap, yeah?"
Liliana BOT 30-03-2023 15:04
While she would gladly confirm, he would find the woman zoned out, staring at the rain, her nostrils flaring as she seems to be... sniffing at something. His voice however brings her out of her stupor and she turns to face him "Huh? Yeah, seems more and more like it... at the same time, getting out of... this would definitely be... welcome"
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 30-03-2023 15:06
"Why is it underground? A cave maybe?"
Narrator BOT 30-03-2023 15:13
Igrim with his eagle eyes pierces the smoke and sees ants cleaning blood off their burrow... That clearly wasn't what he was wanting to find. He keeps looking around and finds a narrow crack in the rocks that seems to open into a cavern below.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 30-03-2023 15:17
For a moment, Igrim focused on the ants and felt pity for them but also somewhat inspired. He shook his head as he heard Laurentina's voice and continued looking before he finally spotted it. "There, a cave indeed." He said with a nod as he pointed to the cavern entrance.

Tavoros BOT 30-03-2023 15:42

Liliana BOT 30-03-2023 15:43

Narrator BOT 30-03-2023 16:20
*Orion begins his climb down holding Freda in his small arms using his large arms to climb. With the safety rope in place Io braces with Igrim to ensure he doesn't fall. About 25 feet in the blood begins to dry as the heat increases. Down 35 feet orion slips on the flaking dried blood but his safety harness works and the pair catches him. He continues down until at the bottom where he can see A large, smoky fire crackles in the center of this room. Battered pots and kettles are stacked all over; clearly, this space serves as a crude kitchen.*
Narrator BOT 30-03-2023 16:21
Without exerting any effort at all Liliana pops her head out of the hole as well behind Orion.
Orion BOT 30-03-2023 16:21
is doing my best to be sneaky boi, blending in to my surrounding
Liliana BOT 30-03-2023 16:22
One one hand, it feels like cheating, but on the other... if you got it, flaunt it. Still, she carefully looks around from their hole perch, trying to glean anything on the owners of the kitchen that she can.
Narrator BOT 30-03-2023 16:49
Liliana's keen ears can hear four distinct gruff voices speaking in an an unknowm language in the room northwest. There is a spit on the fire that seems unattened other than a large slab of meat. Too large to be Fredrik.
Liliana BOT 30-03-2023 16:50
she nudges Orion and holds up 4 fingers, then points in the direction of where the voices came from
Freda Familiar BOT 30-03-2023 16:51
very interested in the smell of meat, Freda perks up looking far more interested in the mission.
Orion BOT 30-03-2023 17:15

Liliana BOT 30-03-2023 17:50
she shrugs, then nods, holding her finger to her lips to indicate him being silent
Orion BOT 30-03-2023 17:52
shifts my carapace to the sight variation in the new surroundings, I hide along the wall and slowly sneak forward
Narrator BOT 30-03-2023 18:03
The walls and floor of this natural cave have been carefully smoothed. You can discern at least three other routes leading off into darkness. a crude wooden cage door closes off the southern exit. The floor is covered with sleeping furs, crates, sacks, and rubbish. There are four humanoids creatures with large fangs talking amongst eachother seemingly arguing over something in an unknown language. (edited)
Avrae BOT 30-03-2023 18:04
Jennifer [Ssra‚Åπ] | [Alnak‚Åµ] -8
Medium monster.

Tavoros BOT 31-03-2023 08:19
*Considers giving Orion a scratch on the head, but finds himself having a lot of complex feelings about it. He doesn't want to come across as condescending, but maybe this is what they do in his culture. He's also a bit confused about the anatomy of Orion, and where it would be best to give him a scratch. Plus, it seems very intimate; maybe in time he'd feel comfortable, but it seems a bit forward right now. That said, he had already let Orion use his teleporting ability. And you know what they say...'those who explore the house of a creepy necromancer together, stay together.' In the end, in all his confused thoughts, he ends up just awkwardly placing his hand on Orion's head saying,* "Nice work buddy, that was some impressive climbing and sneaking! And thanks for looking after Freda. Could you tell which way an entrance might be from down there?" (edited)

Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 01-04-2023 12:34

Liliana BOT 01-04-2023 12:51

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 01-04-2023 12:55

The path climbs up one last steep switchback toward a bare shoulder of rock. The hillside rises steeply on your right and drops away precipitously on your left. Debris and rubbish lie scattered over the last hundred yards or so‚Äîdiscarded water skins, bits of charred bone, and splintered casks or kegs. Up ahead, the path opens onto a wide ledge and then doubles back sharply into the mountainside. Two bestial humanoids in hide armor stand watch on the ledge. They appear inattentive and bored.

Marble steps cracked with age and veined with green moss lead up to a strong double door of carved stone, eight feet wide and almost ten feet tall. Narrator BOT 03-04-2023 12:23
The great door opens into a large hall. A narrow ledge overlooks a deep, dark crevasse that cuts the room in two. A dangerous-looking rope bridge, frayed and thin, spans the gap. Water gurgles and rushes somewhere far below. Two copper braziers burn brightly on either side of the door, illuminating the western half of the room. Another ledge is barely visible on the other side of the chasm.

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 11-04-2023 13:50

Orion BOT 22-04-2023 05:20

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 22-04-2023 10:47

Tavoros BOT 22-04-2023 11:39
*Tavoros unrolls his blanket in the cleanest, most dry part of the room. Instead of lying down, he sits and unwraps a bronze amulet on which he had been working before he left. He polishes it up, before holding it in his hand, letting himself become one with the magic imbued within. Doing this, he's never felt more like a drink before. He knows this is a symptom of being in his Autumn form, but it seems somewhat increased by the new amulet he's just hung around his neck. He decides to open one of his flasks of wine, and drinks it slowly as the magic from the amulet flows into him. He knows this is a slippery slope, and he can't stay in his autumn form with 4 more flasks of wine still in his pack. He decides that his companions seem ok with him now, and don't seem bothered by his enthusiastic tendancies...or at least none of them have said anything. He decides to spend this time to change into his spring form. After an hour or so, and with Freda curled up on his chest, he relaxes into a trance, sitting upright against the wall, with Freda purring in his lap. As he rests, his hair transforms from brown to blonde, and when he opens his eyes they have become piercing blue, rather than hazel.* (edited)
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 22-04-2023 14:10
Once everyone was awake, Igrim made sure all his gear was ready before moving towards the northern wall where he found the mechanism and pressed his ear against it and listened for a second. "Nothing I can hear. Still be ready though." He drew one arrow from his quiver. "Everyone ready?"
Narrator BOT 22-04-2023 14:57
The ceiling soars thirty feet high in the center of this impressive chamber, and the walls are carved with images of dwarves at their forges. Two large stone doors exit to the north and south. Several old skeletons lie scattered near the northern door. A gate of wrought iron stands in the western wall. In the center of the floor, a natural rift descends sharply. Dozens of stone steps lead down into darkness. You can hear the distant sound of running water and a curious skittering coming from far below.
Liliana BOT 22-04-2023 14:58
"Well, if that's not promising..." She deadpans, listening to the skittering "Bugs, and not the Orion-Friendly kind either, I'd guess"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 22-04-2023 14:59
"I'm definitely not the only one who hears that right?" Igrim notched the arrow into his bow and started to step into the room while trying to keep his steps as silent as possible.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 22-04-2023 15:44
Igrim tsks silently as he looked down into the darkness, unable to see anything so goes back to the group and goes to Laurentina. "Can you do that thing again?" He said, putting his bracer forward. (edited)
Narrator BOT 22-04-2023 16:22

Igrim can see that the descending fissure opens up abruptly into a very high cavern, its ceiling easily forty feet or more overhead. A fast-moving stream about five feet wide runs across the floor of the chamber from the north and disappears under a low stone overhang to the south, and larger passageways exit to the southeast and the northeast. Narrator BOT 30-04-2023 17:47
Floundering through the cold, swift stream, you emerge in a huge cavern. The ceiling must be thirty feet overhead, and the far end of the cave is lost in darkness. A foul stench assaults your nostrils immediately. The remnants of butchered game animals hang from crude wooden stakes along the cavern walls, and you spot a pair of orc corpses treated in the same fashion.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 30-04-2023 18:27
"Wow..." Igrim stated as he reappeared from underwater, looking at the two orc corpses strewn along the walls. "Looks like there are things definitely worse than the orcs here. Things strong enough to treat them like wild game."
Narrator BOT 30-04-2023 21:53
Upon surfacing distracted by the stench and sights of the room the bat starts making chirps to get a sense of the room as well. His keen perception allowing him to spot camouflaged troglodytes hiding nearby. Once Tavoros surfaces he manages to spot only one of the two camouflaged troglodytes. Once he surfaces they attack before any others come up.
Narrator BOT 30-04-2023 22:46

One claws Igrim twice but fails to bite into him. The remaining two manage to bite into Tavoros one manages to rake his claws as well but the second Tavoros nimbly avoids.

Narrator BOT 06-05-2023 01:19
As the last of the troglodytes falls, the battle-worn party surveys the scene before them. The once open doorway to the warren is now a macabre barricade of twisted and broken troglodyte bodies. The gruesome heap of scales, mottled flesh, and sharp claws seems almost to meld together, creating a grotesque tapestry that spans the width and height of the narrow passageway. The pungent stench of troglodyte blood and viscera assaults the senses, mingling with the acrid odor of sweat and the metallic tang of spilled blood. Each labored breath draws the nauseating miasma deeper into your lungs, a stark reminder of the brutality that has transpired here. The dim light filtering through the gaps in the makeshift barricade casts eerie, flickering shadows on the walls of the chamber. It's clear that moving forward will require a concerted effort to clear the passageway, as the weight of the fallen threatens to block your path to the secrets that lie beyond.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 06-05-2023 01:19
Seeing as the wall of corpses completely blocked the view, Igrim pulled farther back and took a knee as he pulled his bowstring taut in wait for their foes to come into view once more.

Liliana BOT 06-05-2023 09:31

Tavoros BOT 06-05-2023 09:46

Narrator BOT 06-05-2023 14:44
As the party stands before the grisly wall of fallen troglodytes, the weight of their next decision hangs heavily in the air. The pungent stench of death mingles with the faint, mournful keening echoing through the dark corridors. The troglodytes have suffered greatly, and their pain is evident in every lifeless form that makes up the macabre barricade before them. The adventurers find themselves faced with a difficult choice. On one hand, they can continue their assault on the remaining troglodytes to ensure the creatures do not retaliate against them. The slaughter would be swift, but it would leave no room for mercy or understanding. By extinguishing the entire clan, the party may guarantee their own safety, but they must ask themselves if that cost is one they're willing to bear. On the other hand, the party can choose to leave the troglodytes to grieve and rebuild from the terrible losses they've suffered. They would be allowing the creatures to regain their strength, but they would also be granting them the chance to recover and potentially change their ways. They cannot predict the actions of the troglodytes in the future, but in this moment, the adventurers have the opportunity to show compassion and mercy. The silence that follows is thick with contemplation as the party members consider the paths before them. The choice is theirs to make, and with it, the potential to alter the fate of both the troglodyte clan and their own journey in this treacherous dungeon.
Io BOT 06-05-2023 15:44
_Io considers the options apparent to them._ ‚ÄúPerhaps‚Ä¶ we should leave them. They seem to want no business with us. I have no issue with leaving them to their own devices.‚Äù
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 06-05-2023 15:46
"Neither do I. It seems like more effort than it's worth at this point. Unless they come back out and attack us, I say we leave them be."
Narrator BOT 06-05-2023 16:03
As the party members reach a consensus, they decide to show mercy and leave the troglodytes alone, allowing them to grieve and rebuild in peace. The air seems to shift ever so slightly, as if acknowledging the weight of their compassionate choice. With the decision made, the adventurers now turn their thoughts to the next steps in their journey through the treacherous depths of the Hidden Cave. Four potential courses of action lie before them: 1. Return to the Orc Captives: The party could retrace their steps to the orc captives they previously encountered. They could check on their well-being and escort them to the safety of the nearby town, which would also provide an opportunity to resupply and gather any needed provisions. They can additionally find respite at the welcoming Blue Water Inn. After spending two days underground, the warm beds and hearty meals would provide a much-needed break from the perils of the dungeon. However, this choice comes with the risk of losing progress in their exploration, as the dungeon's inhabitants may regroup or reinforce their defenses during the party's absence. 2. Follow the Stream: The adventurers may choose to press on, following the dark stream that winds through the dungeon to the next chamber. The sound of water echoes through the air, hinting at hidden secrets and untold dangers that await them further along this path. 3. Backtrack to the High Cavern: The party could decide to backtrack to the high cavern they previously passed through, opting to explore a new path that might lead them to other areas of the Hidden Cave. The echoing sounds of their footsteps would be their only companions as they delve deeper into the unknown. 4. Take a Short Rest: Recognizing the need for respite, the adventurers could choose to find a safe and relatively comfortable nook within the dungeon to take a short rest. There, they could regain their strength, tend to any wounds, and strategize before continuing their exploration of the t
Narrator BOT 06-05-2023 16:03
reacherous depths. As the party weighs their options, each member considers the potential rewards and risks that accompany each path. Ultimately, the decision they make will shape the course of their adventure and could have lasting effects on the world around them.
Tavoros BOT 06-05-2023 22:15
Having decided to leave the Troglodytes alone, Tavoros rests with the others while they contemplate their next steps. He grabs a flask from his pack, and drinks it down to quench his thirst. "This cave system is much bigger than I thought, the Burgomaster definitely didn't tell us the scale of what lay ahead... though I guess he might not have known." he says, matter-of-factly.
Tavoros BOT 06-05-2023 22:17
"Does anyone want a drink? I think I've got enough for everyone. It's not the finest wine, but it serves its purpose." he offers.
Narrator BOT 06-05-2023 23:40
As the party retraces their steps through the troglodyte warren, the pervasive, foul stench clings to their clothes and armor, a potent reminder of the battles they've fought and the horrors they've encountered. The dank air feels heavy, and the eerie silence envelops the adventurers, leaving them with their thoughts and the sounds of their own footsteps echoing through the dimly lit tunnels. Upon reaching the entrance to prisoner's cave, the party takes a moment to brace themselves, preparing for the sight of the weakened human prisoners, Courana and Geradil, still locked up in their dismal cell. As they step inside, the two humans look up, their eyes filled with a mixture of hope and fear. The prisoners instantly notice the change in the party's appearance and the overwhelming stench that now clings to them.
Courana BOT 06-05-2023 23:40
Courana's face contorts into an expression of disgust, barely able to contain her revulsion at the smell. She coughs and tries to cover her nose, but the effort is futile in the face of such a powerful odor. "By the gods, what have you been doing?" she exclaims, her voice strained and weak, not recognizing the origin of the terrible smell.
Geradil BOT 06-05-2023 23:40
Geradil, on the other hand, seems less bothered by the smell, his focus more on the fact that the party has returned as promised. His eyes widen with relief, and he slowly rises to his feet, leaning heavily against the wall. "You came back," he says, his voice hoarse from dehydration and disuse. "I feared we'd be left here to rot."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 06-05-2023 23:42
"Killing. A lot of killing." Igrim pulled down his hood as he approached the cell door and took a look at the lock before turning to Tavoros. "Can you pick this like you disarmed that trap?"
Courana BOT 06-05-2023 23:44
Her eyes adopting a hopeful look she asks, "Your going to finally set us free?"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 06-05-2023 23:46
"Depends. Are you two going to be loud and unruly? Or are you going to follow what we say until we get into town?"
Narrator BOT 07-05-2023 00:09
Courana and Geradil exchange glances, both visibly relieved at the prospect of finally being set free. They understand the need for caution and restraint on the journey back to town, especially considering the ordeal they've just been through.
Courana BOT 07-05-2023 00:09
Looking earnestly at Igrim, says, "We understand that you're taking a risk by setting us free, and we're grateful for your help. We promise to follow your instructions and keep quiet until we reach town. We just want to get away from this awful place and start rebuilding our lives."
Geradil BOT 07-05-2023 00:09
Nods in agreement, adding, "We owe you our lives, and we won't cause any trouble. We'll do whatever you say, just please get us out of here and back to safety." His voice is firm, showing his determination to cooperate and make the journey as smooth as possible for everyone involved.
Narrator BOT 07-05-2023 01:21
As Tavoros pulls out his set of thieves' tools and begins to carefully work on the lock, his fingers deftly manipulating the picks, it's clear he has experience in dealing with such challenges. He can feel the tumbler inside the lock shifting, but despite his best efforts, he struggles to find the right alignment. His concentration is evident, but after a few tense moments, the lock remains stubbornly closed. Tavoros, realizing his attempt has been unsuccessful, lets out a quiet sigh and steps back, a hint of frustration crossing his face.
Courana BOT 07-05-2023 01:22
Seeing the failed attempt, Courana's expression shifts from hope to disappointment, and she bites her lower lip, trying to hold back her mounting anxiety.
Geradil BOT 07-05-2023 01:22
While also visibly disheartened, tries to maintain a semblance of optimism, saying in a quiet voice, "It's alright. These things happen. I'm sure you'll find a way to get us out of here eventually." The note of hope in his voice is faint, but it's clear he's trying to keep the situation from becoming even more tense.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 07-05-2023 01:31
Igrim nods and lets out a sigh before then turning to Orion. "Your ram's turn then." He looks to the two prisoners and waves them away. "You two, stick to the wall and face away."
Narrator BOT 07-05-2023 02:40
Orion, assessing the situation, decides it's time for a more forceful approach. He reaches into his pack and pulls out a portable ram, the sturdy iron head glinting in the dim light. With a determined nod, he enlists Igrim's help, and together they position themselves in front of the locked gate. With a shared look of resolve, they take a step back, grip the ram tightly, and charge forward. The sound of the impact echoes through the chamber as the heavy iron ram slams into the gate. Though the lock itself holds firm, the sheer force of the blow causes the metal bars to buckle and bend at the point of impact. The twisted bars now create a gap just wide enough for Courana and Geradil to squeeze through. Shards of metal and splinters of wood litter the ground where the gate has been compromised, a testament to the immense power behind Orion and Igrim's combined efforts. As Courana and Geradil regard the damaged gate, their eyes widen with awe and relief. They carefully approach the opening, gingerly navigating the jagged edges as they make their way through the newly formed passage to freedom. After Courana and Geradil squeeze through the gap in the bent bars, they take a moment to catch their breath and process what just happened. The sound of the ram strike still ringing in their ears, they look back at the damaged gate with a mix of awe and relief.
Courana BOT 07-05-2023 02:40
Wide-eyed, exclaims, "I've never seen anything like that before! You two are incredible!" She rubs her arms where they brushed against the jagged edges of the bent bars, but the minor scrapes seem trivial compared to the freedom she's just gained.
Geradil BOT 07-05-2023 02:40
Still visibly shaken but grateful, nods in agreement. "We can't thank you enough for getting us out of that cell," he says, his voice thick with emotion. "Your strength and determination have given us a second chance, and we won't forget that. We'll do everything we can to make this journey back to town as easy as possible."
Narrator BOT 07-05-2023 02:40
Their expressions reflect the newfound hope they feel, and they stand ready to follow the party's lead, eager to put the nightmare of their captivity behind them.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 07-05-2023 03:09
Igrim nods and gestures zipping his lips shut. "As promised. I'm pretty sure we cleared this floor out but we can't be too careful. We're going to bring you to Barovia and when we get there, you two need to go to the Burgomaster, Ismark and tell him everything that happened. He should be able to give you at least a few days of lodging or until you get on your feet. Do you understand?"
Narrator BOT 07-05-2023 03:17
As Courana and Geradil listen to Igrim's instructions, they can't help but notice the lingering stench that clings to the party after their time spent in the troglodyte warren.
Courana BOT 07-05-2023 03:17
Her nose wrinkling in distaste, hesitantly brings up the subject. "Um, I don't mean to overstep, but considering the... odor that seems to have stuck to you, it might be a good idea to wash up before we head into town. It could draw unwanted attention or make it difficult for people to trust us," Courana suggests cautiously.
Geradil BOT 07-05-2023 03:17
Nodding in agreement, adds, "We understand that we need to be cautious and quiet, but perhaps finding a safe spot near a stream or some other water source for a quick clean-up would be beneficial. It might help us blend in a bit better when we get to Barovia. And of course, we'll follow your lead and stay as quiet as possible."
Narrator BOT 07-05-2023 03:17
With their intentions clear and the suggestion of washing off the lingering stench on the table, Courana and Geradil stand ready to follow the party, their gazes filled with determination and hope for a brighter future.
Orion BOT 07-05-2023 03:57
[t]"I think the stench will help ward off potential threats."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 07-05-2023 05:45
"Or attract them. But rivers are where animals and monsters tend to all be. Everything, except undead I suppose, needs water. We'll clean up once we're close enough to the village." Igrim looked back to their two wards and pulled up his hood before turning to the group then to the path in front of him. "Let's go."
Tavoros BOT 07-05-2023 07:43
"I'm sure, what with the interesting rain outside, we won't be turning up clean in Barovia whether we clean ourselves or not. But I can certainly try my best to clean us up, I have a little trick for that." Tavoros adds, without wanting to specifically mention the blood rain. (edited)
Narrator BOT 07-05-2023 12:39
The party, along with Courana and Geradil, retraces their steps through the now eerily quiet dwarven fortress. The once-bustling chambers and halls are now hushed, casting a sense of unease over the group. As they finally emerge from the underground depths, they're met with a drastically different scene than what they left behind. The blood moon has vanished, its sinister presence no longer looming above. The blood rain, too, has ceased its relentless downpour, although the ground still bears the dark stains and slick residue of its passage. Even the air seems to have shifted, the oppressive atmosphere now replaced with a cold, lingering mist that seems to seep into everything. Courana and Geradil, who were completely unaware of the blood moon and rain, are taken aback by the misty landscape before them. They exchange uneasy glances, their expressions reflecting the mix of apprehension and curiosity they feel about their unfamiliar surroundings. Now, the party faces a decision: should they follow the meandering path of the Luna River to the town of Vallaki or journey along the Tser River to reach the Village of Barovia? Each route offers its own challenges. As they stand at this crossroads, the mist swirling around them like silent specters, the party weighs their options, knowing that the fate of Courana, Geradil, and themselves might well hinge upon the path they choose to follow.
Orion BOT 07-05-2023 14:16
[tel]"which town is better suited for taking in refugees?"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 07-05-2023 15:02
"Vallaki would be better in my opinion. It's a little bit closer and there's that waterfall we'll have to go through to get to Barovia, we can't expect them to climb it. And with Vallaki, if we just follow the river, we should be able to find our way there."

Io BOT 07-05-2023 17:15

Tavoros BOT 07-05-2023 17:22
Tavoros reaches into his bag once more and pulls out another furry ball, letting it drop near the group. This time it turns into a giant boar, large in size with thick brown fur and large curved tusks. "Hm, Ok." he says, shrugging his shoulders. "For protection." he adds to the group as they look strangely at him.
Narrator BOT 07-05-2023 17:31
Upon witnessing Tavoros's seemingly innocuous action result in the sudden appearance of a giant boar, Courana and Geradil are visibly taken aback. Their eyes widen in surprise, and they instinctively take a step back from the large creature, its thick brown fur bristling and its curved tusks gleaming menacingly.
Courana BOT 07-05-2023 17:31
Trying to mask her astonishment, lets out a nervous chuckle. "Well, that's certainly...unexpected," she says, casting a sidelong glance at Geradil, who is still eyeing the boar warily.
Geradil BOT 07-05-2023 17:31
Clearing his throat, he manages a weak smile. "Protection, you say? I suppose it's better to have a...uh, formidable ally like this than to be caught unprepared," he says, his voice betraying a hint of uncertainty. "You adventurers certainly have some unusual tricks up your sleeves."
Narrator BOT 07-05-2023 17:31
Both Courana and Geradil continue to observe the boar cautiously, clearly impressed by the display of magic yet remaining slightly uneasy in the presence of such a formidable creature. Their curiosity about their newfound companions only grows, as does their awareness of the potentially dangerous world they now find themselves in.
Tavoros BOT 07-05-2023 17:50
"Oh don't worry, she won't hurt you." he says, walking up to the boar and giving it a scratch behind the ear. The boar clearly enjoys the scratches as it starts making a funny grunting sound, and its back leg gives way as it sits down, lopsided and learns into the ear scratches.
Narrator BOT 07-05-2023 20:37
As the party, accompanied by Courana and Geradil, sets out towards the Luna River, the misty landscape of Barovia surrounds them. The air is damp and cold, sending shivers down their spines as they navigate the uneven terrain. The forest around them is eerily quiet, with only the occasional snap of a twig or rustle of leaves to remind them that they are not alone in this haunted land. Upon reaching the Luna River, they begin to follow its winding course northwards in the direction of Vallaki. The riverbank is overgrown with twisted trees and tangled underbrush, making the journey a slow and arduous one. The water's swift current serves as a guide, leading them towards the relative safety of their destination. As they progress, the party becomes increasingly aware of the dark shapes of buzzards circling overhead. The birds, drawn by the lingering scent of the troglodytes on the adventurers, seem to be biding their time, waiting for an opportunity to swoop down and investigate this potential source of food. The presence of these scavengers is a grim reminder of the dangers that await the party in this cursed land. Traveling onward, the party keeps a wary eye on the circling buzzards, prepared to fend off any unwanted advances from the hungry creatures. The journey is challenging, but they press on, determined to reach their destination and find some reprieve from the oppressive atmosphere of Barovia.

Narrator BOT 07-05-2023 23:15
As the party continues their journey along the Luna River, a distant howling pierces the silence of the Barovian forest, sending chills down their spines. The eerie sound seems to come from all directions, growing louder and more distinct as they press on. It soon becomes apparent that there are multiple howlers, their voices blending together in a haunting symphony. The adventurers tighten their grips on their weapons, eyes darting nervously through the shadows and mist, ready for whatever might emerge.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 07-05-2023 23:18

Courana BOT 07-05-2023 23:59

Her hands tremble as she instinctively reaches for a makeshift weapon‚Äîa sturdy branch lying nearby. Her voice quivers as she tries to maintain a defensive posture. "What is that?" she whispers, barely audible over the eerie chorus of howls. Her eyes dart around the shadowy landscape, searching for any signs of movement, her body tense and ready to react to any threat that might appear.

Narrator BOT 08-05-2023 14:26
Suddenly, a large dire wolf bursts from the shadows of the trees behind the party, its powerful muscles propelling it forward as it charges straight for the giant boar Tavoros summoned. Its fur bristles, and its eyes gleam with feral intensity as it closes the distance. In a flash of teeth and ferocity, the dire wolf bites into the boar, using its massive strength to knock the creature prone. To the north, a chilling sight emerges: a werewolf lopes out of the treeline, its monstrous form blending human and lupine features. It runs towards the party at a terrifying pace, howling a blood-curdling cry that resonates through the forest. Its razor-sharp claws dig into the earth as it bounds forward, a nightmare made flesh, intent on joining the fray and tearing into its prey.
Liliana BOT 08-05-2023 14:27

Geradil BOT 08-05-2023 14:38
As the dire wolf and werewolf burst onto the scene, Geradil's eyes widen with terror. A simple farmer, he has never faced creatures of such savagery and monstrous nature. Clutching the short sword Igrim had given him, he feels the weight of the unfamiliar weapon in his untrained hand. His grip is uncertain, and sweat beads on his brow as he tries to steady his shaking arm. Though fear threatens to consume him, Geradil's innate desire to protect himself and Courana drives him to take a defensive stance. His heart races in his chest as he watches the unfolding chaos, glancing between the dire wolf and the charging werewolf, unsure of where to focus his attention. He swallows hard, attempting to muster the courage to confront these nightmarish creatures and fight for his life.
Narrator BOT 08-05-2023 15:35
Just as the party focuses on the initial dire wolf and the charging werewolf, a second dire wolf emerges from the shadows, lunging towards Liliana with lightning speed. While she feels the sharp sting of the wolf's teeth grazing her, she manages to maintain her balance and footing, demonstrating her martial aptitude in the face of this sudden assault.

Narrator BOT 08-05-2023 16:55
As the battle intensifies, a second werewolf emerges from the misty forest, its eyes gleaming with hunger and malice. The monstrous creature dashes forward, its powerful limbs propelling it with terrifying speed towards the fray. Drool drips from its slavering maw, a clear indication of its ravenous appetite and eagerness to join the hunt. The chilling sight of yet another werewolf entering the scene only serves to heighten the sense of danger and urgency faced by the party.
Narrator BOT 08-05-2023 19:44
As the battle rages on, a third dire wolf appears from the misty forest, its eyes burning with a mix of fury and anguish over the fallen dire wolf. It leaps towards the giant boar, its teeth bared, and tries to deliver a powerful bite. The anger driving this wolf is palpable, causing it to fight with even more ferocity than its companions. At the same time, an Otyugh emerges from the ground on the opposite side of the river, drawn by the scent of the dead dire wolf. It slips into the water, its tentacles propelling it forward as the current sweeps it northward. The Otyugh pushes itself with a burst of speed, dashing towards the other side of the river, almost reaching the shoreline. As it struggles against the current, the Otyugh sends a telepathic image to the minds of the party, the werewolves, and the dire wolves. The image is a tantalizing vision of fresh, delicious meat, a feast fit for kings. The image is vivid and enticing, stirring the appetites of those who receive it and luring them towards the Otyugh's location. (edited)

Courana BOT 08-05-2023 19:58

Despite the ongoing threat posed by the wolves, she believes them to be less formidable than the other monsters that surround her, and hopes that the strength and skills of her new companions will keep her safe.

Narrator BOT 11-05-2023 00:34
The immediate aftermath of the battle is a bizarre spectacle of chaos frozen in time. The riverside scene is a morbid tableau of death and victory. The once serene forest edge is now littered with the bodies of fallen dire wolves, their shaggy hides soaked with blood, mingling with the loamy scent of the riverbank. The two lifeless forms of the werewolves lay sprawled out, their final transformations halted mid-shift, a chilling testament to the brutality of the confrontation. The grotesque corpse of the Otyugh, an aberration alien even in this haunted land, lies in a crumpled heap. Its tentacles, now lifeless, remains limp where it once grasped Io. An arrow protrudes from its open maw, the fatal blow that brought down the creature. Courana and Geradil, witnesses to this violent spectacle, stand in muted silence. Courana's face is a mask of shock, her eyes wide and her hand pressed to her mouth as she surveys the grim scene. Fear and awe vie for dominance in her eyes, and her breath comes in shallow gasps. Geradil, still clutching the short sword, stares at the Otyugh's corpse, the color drained from his face. His chest heaves as he tries to process the scene, his gaze flitting between the fallen beasts and the party - their saviors and their warriors. The forest around them begins to reclaim its sounds - the murmur of the river, the distant hoot of an owl, the rustle of leaves in the gentle wind. Yet, in the wake of the battle, an uneasy silence hangs over the group, a shared understanding of the danger they just faced.
Io BOT 11-05-2023 07:02

Narrator BOT 11-05-2023 12:51
With the adrenaline of the battle slowly ebbing away, the party trudges away from the gruesome, bloody scene they left behind. They carry the stench of battle with them, a potent cocktail of beastly musk, blood, and their own sweat. A chorus of savage cries and the occasional snapping of bone echo from the riverbank, a grim reminder of the ferocity of nature and its indifference to death. They venture deeper into the mist-shrouded forest, the crunching of leaves and snapping of twigs underfoot, their only company in this eerily silent world. The gnarled trees stand sentinel around them, their branches twisted into grotesque shapes, as if reaching out in silent pleas. The canopy above filters the scarce daylight, casting dappled shadows that sway with the gentle breeze. After some time, they find a spot that seems suitable for their needs, a small clearing nestled amidst the dense undergrowth, offering a modicum of visibility and protection. It's not perfect, but it's as secure as they could hope for in these unforgiving wilds. The party settles down, tending to their wounds and exhaustion, all the while keeping a wary eye on the surrounding wilderness. The distant cacophony of scavengers serves as a stark reminder of the dangers that lurk within the mists of Barovia, never far away.
Io BOT 11-05-2023 19:25

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 11-05-2023 21:59

Narrator BOT 11-05-2023 22:08
Emerging from the shelter of the forest, the party once again sets foot on the moist banks of the Luna River. The murky waters flow peacefully by, a stark contrast to the violent scene that played out earlier. The distant squabbling of scavengers has faded, replaced by the softer sounds of the river and the rustling of leaves in the wind. Laurentina takes point, her eyes scanning the path ahead with an expert gaze. Courana and Geradil follow closely, their faces paler than before, their eyes darting nervously around them. The journey north along the river is quiet, the eerie tranquility of Barovia hanging over the landscape like a shroud. The path winds through dense, mossy undergrowth and across narrow, stone-strewn clearings. Every now and then, the party crosses a trickling stream feeding into the Luna, the cool water a welcome relief for their weary feet. Gradually, the thick woods give way to more open land. A chilling wind sweeps over the rolling grasslands, and the looming silhouette of Vallaki can be seen in the distance, its stone walls and buildings shrouded in mist. The party‚Äôs pace quickens slightly, their goal within reach.
Geradil BOT 11-05-2023 22:08

Narrator BOT 11-05-2023 22:08
As they draw nearer, the sounds of Vallaki start to drift towards them - the distant clamor of a bustling town, the clanging of metal from the smithy, the faint chatter of townsfolk.
Courana BOT 11-05-2023 22:08
Looking towards the town with wide eyes, murmuring, "It's bigger than I thought."
Narrator BOT 11-05-2023 22:08
The grand gates of Vallaki come into view, standing tall and firm against the encroaching wilderness. As they approach the entrance, the guards give them a cursory glance before letting them through, their expressions indifferent but their eyes wary. Courana clings to Geradil's arm, her fingers white-knuckled, her gaze set firmly on the cobbled streets before them. After their long journey, the group finally steps onto the cobbled streets of Vallaki, a sense of relief washing over them. Geradil lets out a sigh, while Courana clings to her companion, her eyes wide as she takes in the bustling town. They've made it, for now at least, to the safety of civilization.

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 11-05-2023 22:14

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 11-05-2023 22:16
He looks at Courana and Geradil. "What were your professions back in your old worlds?" (edited)
Courana BOT 11-05-2023 22:41
Looking up at Igrim, her weary eyes showing a hint of pride as she replies, "I was...am, a seamstress. I stitched clothes for the folk of Mirabar - from everyday tunics to the finest gowns for the mayor's wife. It's an honest trade, and it helped me provide for my children. I've always found peace in the rhythm of the needle, you see. I hope to find some semblance of that peace here too, once we're settled." Her gaze drifts off for a moment, perhaps envisioning the thread and fabric in her hands once again. (edited)
Geradil BOT 11-05-2023 22:44
"Me? I worked the land," He replies, his voice carrying a humble note, a hint of pride. "I was a farmer back in Mirabar. You know, wheat, barley, the occasional turnip patch. It was hard work, but there's something about planting a seed and watching it grow that... well, it just feels right." He glances toward the darkening horizon, and his roughened hands unconsciously flex, as if missing the familiar touch of his farming tools. "Never thought I'd miss the sight of a freshly ploughed field, but here we are." (edited)
Tavoros BOT 11-05-2023 22:55

"Come now Courana, Geradil, the first round is on me! I mean it, first round is on me! Beer, Wine? Perhaps something a little stronger?" he says jovially, throwing a wink at Io at the last suggestion. Courana looking at Igrim with a glimmer of hope in her eyes,* "We would be very grateful, kind sir," she says, her voice barely above a whisper. (edited)
Geradil BOT 12-05-2023 13:27
Standing slightly behind her, simply nods in agreement, his eyes showing a mixture of exhaustion and relief.
Narrator BOT 12-05-2023 13:27
Vallaki, despite its grim nature, offers a sense of safety compared to the wilderness. The group moves through the cobblestone streets, past the silhouettes of towering buildings and the occasional flicker of light escaping from curtained windows. The town is quiet, the inhabitants having retreated to the safety of their homes for the night. Before long, the warm glow of the Blue Water Inn appears at the end of the street. Its sturdy structure offers a stark contrast to the uncertainty they've just escaped. As they approach, the door swings open, revealing a cozy, bustling interior. The scent of warm food, the low murmur of conversation, and the crackling of the hearth offer a soothing balm to their frayed nerves. Courana and Geradil visibly relax, their shoulders dropping as the tension leaves them. The Innkeeper greets them with a warm smile and the promise of a hot meal, a welcome reception after the trials of the day.
Geradil BOT 12-05-2023 13:27
Managing to give a small smile, his hand resting protectively on Courana's shoulder, "Thank you, truly. Your kindness won't be forgotten." His voice is still shaky, but there's a newfound determination there. They're safe, for now, and that's all that matters.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 12-05-2023 13:56
"Eat for now. I'll get your rooms sorted out." He starts to walk to the innkeeper but stops and turns around. "Uhh, should I get two rooms or one?" (edited)
Courana BOT 12-05-2023 15:10
Still wide-eyed from the recent events, glances at Geradil, who is focused on his meal, his face a mask of concentration. She then looks back at Igrim and replies, "One room will do, thank you. We've...we've been through quite a bit together already. Best to stick close, I suppose." Geradil, without looking up from his food, simply nods in agreement.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 12-05-2023 15:27
Igrim just puts a thumbs up and approaches the innkeeper. "Excuse me, do you have any rooms available? I'd like to get for a couple of days for those two." He points behind him, pointing at Courana and Geradil.
Narrator BOT 12-05-2023 15:36
The innkeeper, a sturdy Barovian woman with a stern expression, looks over at Courana and Geradil. She seems to size them up before turning back to Igrim, her gaze softening slightly. "Aye, we've got rooms available. You'll be wanting meals as well, I assume?" She asks, already pulling out a ledger and an inkwell. "Two days, was it?" She queries, dipping the quill into the ink.
Tavoros BOT 12-05-2023 16:20
Tavoros pops up at the bar too, saying "Oh and 6 bottles of wine too, if you don't mind? But I'll get this." he adds, reaching for his coin purse. Seeing the innkeeper reach for a higher shelf, he interrupts her, "No, sorry, not the good stuff. That'll do fine." he says, pointing to the cheap looking bottles stacked on the floor.
Narrator BOT 12-05-2023 16:29
The innkeeper, a stout Barovian woman with a weary, lined face, nods at Tavoros's request. She eyes him for a moment before her gaze shifts to the less appealing, dust-covered bottles of wine stacked haphazardly on the floor. "Suit yourself," she mutters, her voice roughened by years of inhaling the inn's smokey air. She stoops to gather the requested bottles, their labels faded and worn. The corks are dry and brittle, a testament to their age and lack of quality. But Tavoros seems unbothered, his focus on the task at hand. As she sets the bottles down with a thud, a small cloud of dust rises, hovering in the air for a moment before it settles back down onto the worn wooden counter. The sound draws the attention of a few patrons, but their interest quickly fades as they return to their drinks and quiet conversations. "Cheap wine for a cheap night, eh?" the innkeeper teases with a humorless smile as she accepts his coins, her rough fingers brushing against Tavoros's in the exchange. "Enjoy your night."
Tavoros BOT 12-05-2023 16:31
Not wanting to appear like he's short-changing the innkeep by buying the cheap stuff, he slides another couple of gold pieces across the bar, and with a wink, he's back off to the table with bottles and cups clutched to his chest. "Hopefully we will!"
Narrator BOT 12-05-2023 16:33
His gesture is not lost on the innkeeper, who pockets the extra coins with a nod of grudging appreciation. There's a spark of curiosity in her eyes as she watches Tavoros navigate through the room, his arms laden with the bottles and cups. "Generous one, isn't he?" she murmurs to herself, a faint smile curling at the corner of her lips. Tavoros‚Äôs path through the dim-lit tavern is a dance between the crowded tables and the inebriated patrons. The low murmur of hushed conversations fills the air, punctuated by the occasional outburst of laughter or the clink of tankards. The tavern's rustic charm seems to come alive in this moment - the flickering candlelight casting long shadows on the wooden beams, the earthy aroma of old ale and woodsmoke, the worn floorboards creaking under the weight of stories untold.
Tavoros BOT 12-05-2023 17:04

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 12-05-2023 22:37
"Oh no, I'm looking for one room for 7 days. That should give them enough time to get on their feet." He said as he looked back to the pair before tirning back and reaching for his pouch. "How much is that?"
Narrator BOT 12-05-2023 22:40
The innkeeper looks surprised, her eyebrows shooting up towards her hairline. "Seven days? Well, aren't you the generous sort?" she says, her voice carrying a note of respect and amusement. She then shakes her head, a small, surprised laugh escaping her. "Apologies, I forget myself. Here in Barovia, we don't usually charge for rooms. It's one of the few blessings we have. All we ask is for respect towards the establishment and the other patrons. So, consider the room on the house... for now." She pauses, her gaze studying Igrim with a newfound interest. "Just don't forget us when you strike it rich, alright?" she adds, her tone light but the underlying sentiment serious.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 12-05-2023 22:45
"Oh... okay." He rubs the back of his head. "Considering what those two have been through, they'll probably do anything to keep those rooms so respecting it shouldn't be a problem." He nods. "Thank you Miss. Can I ask how much one meal costs here?"
Narrator BOT 12-05-2023 22:49
The innkeeper nods, pulling a cloth from her apron to wipe down a recently vacated spot on the counter. She turns back to Igrim, a business-like air about her now. "Ah, for a hearty meal, it'll be two silver pieces per serving," she says, counting it out on her fingers for emphasis. "Good, filling fare, perfect for after a long day."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 12-05-2023 22:52
He nods. "Thank you. I'll go talk to them." He turns and walks to Courana and Geradil, putting five gold pieces each in front of them. "These should last you over a week's worth of meals here. 3 meals per day. Hopefully that's enough time for you to get your things in order, it shouldn't be too hard."
Narrator BOT 12-05-2023 23:07
Courana and Geradil look up as Igrim approaches, placing a small pile of gold coins in front of each of them. Their eyes widen in surprise, glancing from the gold to Igrim and back again, their mouths falling open in shock.
Courana BOT 12-05-2023 23:07
Slowly, Courana reaches out, her fingers lightly brushing the cool metal of the coins. "This... this is..." she stammers, her voice thick with emotion.
Geradil BOT 12-05-2023 23:07
Simply stares at the gold, his usual gruff demeanor momentarily lost. He swallows hard, his hand shaking slightly as he too reaches out to touch the coins.
Narrator BOT 12-05-2023 23:07
Both of them look up at Igrim again, gratitude shining in their eyes. They don't need to say the words; their expressions convey more thanks than any words could. As Igrim walks away, they sit in stunned silence, the reality of their unexpected windfall slowly sinking in.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 12-05-2023 23:32
Igrim walked away and put his hood up before stepping out the door to make his way out of the inn and towards the Dusklight Supply.
Tavoros BOT 13-05-2023 12:05

Io BOT 14-05-2023 01:36
_As the night winds down, and Io thinks about returning to the cave, she begins to realize that she doesn't really have the focus or energy required to continue the adventure._ "Unfortunately, I believe this will be my last night with thou all for this mission. I do not believe I have it in me to continue." _She says to the group._
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 14-05-2023 09:12
Right at that moment, Igrim returned, now fully stocked with a surplus of arrows and other utilities. "Did I hear that right?" Igrim looked around to read the room and nodded. "I see. It was a pleasure working with you, Io. I hope our paths cross again in the future, your assistance has been invaluable." He bowed his head in respect and raised it once more.
Narrator BOT 14-05-2023 12:47
As the morning light filters through the windows of the inn, the party members stir, slowly coming to life after their well-deserved rest. Among them, Io seems restless, her usual jovial demeanor replaced with a thoughtful, distant expression. Gathering the party, she announces her decision. "Friends," she begins, her voice steady, "It is time for me to part ways with our group." The news is met with surprise, a few gasps echoing in the quiet room. But there is no argument, no pleading for her to stay. They've all faced enough to know that when a decision like this is made, it's often irrevocable. They share a quiet breakfast together, their last meal as a party of six. When they finish, Io stands, her pack already slung over her shoulder. She smiles at each of them in turn, a silent farewell before she steps out into the crisp morning air, leaving the remaining five to continue their journey back to the hidden cave.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 14-05-2023 13:19

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 14-05-2023 14:43

Narrator BOT 14-05-2023 18:47
Resupplied and revitalized, the party, guided by the ever-watchful Igrim, embarks once again from Dusklight Supply. They follow the familiar path along the Luna river, their footprints from the previous day still visible in the soft earth, a silent testament to their previous journey. The forest seems to hold its breath as they pass, the creatures within aware of the formidable party moving through their domain. Birds chirp from the treetops, their songs echoing amidst the rustling leaves, while the river flows beside them, its serene babble a constant companion. Eventually, they arrive at the site of the previous day's bloody conflict. The remnants of their fierce battle with the beasts of the wild are surprisingly scarce; the forest has reclaimed its own. The carcasses of the fallen have been dragged away, most likely by scavengers seizing an opportunistic meal. Now, only dark, matted patches of grass and discolored stains on the rocks mark where the dire wolves and werewolves had met their end. The quiet, undisturbed landscape belies the violent struggle that had taken place here, a stark reminder of the relentless and uncaring cycle of nature. The scene is an eerie one, imbued with a certain grim tranquility. The party moves on, their destination still ahead: the hidden cave that waits for their return.
Narrator BOT 14-05-2023 19:39
The group winds their way away from the Luna River, now following a narrow trail that leads them towards the imposing silhouette of Mount Ghakis. The mountain, a monolith of age-old stone and silent wisdom, looms ahead, its towering peaks scraping the sky. The forest starts to thin as they ascend, the ground becoming rockier, the air crisper. The trees are gnarled and wind-bent here, their roots clinging tenaciously to the mountainside. The symphony of the forest fades to the ethereal quietude of high altitudes, punctuated by the occasional call of a mountain bird or the distant echo of falling rocks. As they climb, the path veers and twists, sometimes fading almost to nothingness, only to reappear again around a bend. It's a strenuous hike, but the adventurers press on, their eyes set on their destination. Suddenly, the hidden cave appears, like a ghost materializing from the mountainside. Its entrance, a gaping maw set in the rocky face of Mount Ghakis, exudes an air of foreboding and mystery. The mountain seems to hold its breath, the wind hushes its whispers, and even the wildlife falls silent as the adventurers approach the cave.
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 14-05-2023 22:04
had disappeared while the rest were in town only showing up again when they were ready to meet up again, her face seems softer, her hair a bit more pale. "Do we know where to go this time?"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 14-05-2023 23:48
"We don't need to spend time exploring the cave this time, so we should just go straight into the deeper cavern but let's try to get through quietly, in case the troglodytes recuperated enough to set up some new defenses."
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 14-05-2023 23:50

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 14-05-2023 23:52

Narrator BOT 15-05-2023 00:44
Guided by the steady hand of Igrim, the party ventures back into the cavernous maw of the hidden cave. The hooded lantern in Igrim's grasp casts a subtle glow, enough to illuminate the immediate path but not enough to announce their presence to any potential threats lurking in the shadowy depths. Behind him, Liliana, Laurentina, Orion, and Tavoros follow single file, their steps hushed whispers against the gravelly floor. The path twists and turns, mimicking the natural formation of the mountainside, a labyrinthine journey that leads them ever deeper into the heart of Mount Ghakis. The air grows colder, heavy with the scent of damp earth and stone, a tangible reminder of the mountain's formidable presence encompassing them. As they snake their way around a particular bend, an audible disturbance shatters the near silence. A low, guttural growl rumbles, echoing ominously within the narrow passage. Igrim's grip tightens on the lantern, his instincts on high alert. He can't see the source of the sound just yet, the lantern's limited light swallowed by the inky blackness beyond. But the sound was unmistakable. Something large, something powerful, was just around the bend, and it was well aware of their presence. A cave bear, perhaps, accustomed to the solitude of its mountain refuge, now disturbed by the intruding adventurers. Unseen, but undeniably present, the creature's growl is a wordless warning. The party holds their breath, each member casting glances at one another in the dim light. They are on the precipice of an encounter, the outcome of which hangs in the balance of their next move.
Liliana BOT 15-05-2023 13:38
As quietly as possible the Dhampir draws her blade, gesturing toward the rest and then to the growls with a quizzical expression
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 15-05-2023 13:42
*After recognizing what they were up against, Igrim quickly nocked an arrow into his bow and peeked over the corner, trying to aim for the bears. Then he realized the darkness was completely hindering his darkness. So with a sigh, he just closed his eyes, choosing to lean on his other 4 senses instead to try to at least hit the bear. And so he released two arrows in quick succession. The bear's fur muffled the noise of the blood splatter but he did hear and feel as the bear's body crashed into the ground, limp.* (edited)

Orion BOT 15-05-2023 14:53

Narrator BOT 15-05-2023 18:00
Having quelled the threat of the cave bears with a swift and relentless onslaught, the party presses onward, their path lit by the soft glow of the hooded lantern. The air in the abandoned fortress resonates with the eerie quietude of a tomb, the once bustling halls now silent, save for the distant echo of their footfalls against the cold stone floor. As they traverse the ghostly remnants of the dwarven stronghold, they come across a grim tableau - the fallen bodies of the orcs they'd previously encountered. Unattended, the corpses have begun their inevitable return to the earth, the pungent stench of decay hanging heavy in the stale air. It's a stark reminder of the fortress's current state, a monument to battles past and the transient nature of life. Unfazed, they continue their trek, navigating the winding corridors with a singular purpose. Their journey leads them to a staircase, its steps carved from the heart of the mountain, descending into the bowels of the fortress. Each step they take is a descent into the unknown, their anticipation heightened by the encroaching darkness below. Finally, they arrive at a vast cavern, its ceiling lost to the shadows far above. The sheer scale of it is awe-inspiring, a testament to the dwarves' architectural prowess and their ability to shape the very mountain to their will. Despite the ominous quiet, there's a sense of reverence here, a hallowed atmosphere that speaks of history and a civilization long past.
Narrator BOT 15-05-2023 20:21
The group enters an expansive, high-ceilinged cavern, its grandeur a stark contrast to the narrow confines of the passages they've been traversing. The cavern branches out in multiple directions, like the arteries of a great, subterranean heart, each passage carrying the promise of secrets yet to be discovered. To the north, the rough, organic lines of the cave give way to deliberate craftmanship. The mouth of the tunnel, cut into a neat square, bears the unmistakable signs of skilled labour, a testament to the determined hands that shaped it from the living rock. A gate of unrefined timber, its logs hewn roughly and assembled with a sense of urgency, obstructs a smaller passage to the northeast. It stands as an incongruous sight, a symbol of civilization within the untamed heart of the mountain. Three other tunnels twist and turn towards the south, their winding paths disappearing into the inky darkness. These passages, untouched by the hands of artisans, retain their natural, irregular forms, their walls glistening with the dampness inherent to the deep caves. The air within the cavern is heavy, laden with the unmistakable, pungent scent of animals. It's a primal aroma, a reminder of the wild, untamed creatures that call this labyrinthine network of tunnels and chambers their home.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 16-05-2023 00:06
Igrim turned to the group, to Tavoros specifically. "Sending in your bat friend might be a good idea here."
Orion BOT 16-05-2023 12:03
[t]" I can scout ahead and report back through telepathy"
Liliana BOT 16-05-2023 12:04
"That would work, you are, no offense, small enough"
Orion BOT 16-05-2023 12:09
