Igrim Luxgarde BOT 16-05-2023 12:53
"If you're confident, then go ahead."
Orion BOT 16-05-2023 12:55
slips into the shadows, carapace shifting to match the surrounding stone [T] "I am the night!"
Narrator BOT 16-05-2023 16:23
Adapting to the surroundings like a true predator, Orion's chameleon carapace seamlessly takes on the hue and texture of the stony walls. His vision, though stripped of color in the darkness, sharpens to discern even the slightest movements or anomalies in his surroundings. As he navigates the cavern's periphery, he catches sight of a peculiar formation - a shape subtly different from the ordinary roughness of the stone. It's a Troglodyte, its naturally camouflaged skin mimicking the rock almost to perfection, hunkered down in a position of ambush. Its stealth, while impressive, is a touch less refined than Orion's own. The creature, poised for attack, appears oblivious to Orion's presence. Lost in the monochromatic world of his darkvision, the Troglodyte blends into the stony landscape, unknowingly outmatched by the superior camouflage of the scout silently observing it. Unaware of its failed ambush, the creature continues to wait, offering Orion the advantage of the first move.
Orion BOT 16-05-2023 18:32
recognizing the troglodyte, but unsure if they are truly hostile, or just trying to survive, I reach out with my minds voice in an attempt to communicate with the lizard-like creature, extending my thoughts to my party in hopes they will pick up on that I've seen. [T]"Greetings, stealthy one. I do not wish you harm. Let us pass, and we will leave your kind alone as well. You may follow, and collect the bodies of our kills to feed your clan. Nod if you agree."
Narrator BOT 16-05-2023 18:52
From its concealed vantage point, the Troglodyte is momentarily taken aback when a voice penetrates the silence of its mind. The voice is strange, yet comprehensible. Its primitive eyes dart around the cavern, scanning for the source of the unexpected communication. Intrigued but wary, it cautiously edges around the corner, its attention drawn to the group of adventurers who have just entered its domain. Unable to discern that the voice in its head originated from the invisible presence mere feet away, it assumes it's one of the newcomers. (Troglodyte) "Fleshwalkers offer food. Speaking into my mind. Where is the food fleshwalker?" The Troglodyte responds in its crude, rasping language, its words echoing off the cavern walls, reaching only the ears of its unseen kin. As its words fill the silence, the other hidden Troglodytes instinctively tense. Their ambush, meticulously planned and executed, is now threatened. In their harsh, guttural tongue, they admonish their comrade, their voices carrying a note of urgency. (Troglodyte) "Fool! You've revealed us to the Fleshwalkers!" The cavern fills with a palpable tension as the Troglodytes' unseen dispute unfolds, their words lost on the adventurers, their presence still unacknowledged by them.
Orion BOT 16-05-2023 19:03
opens his mind to the rest of the troglodyte's in the cavern that he just heard speaking, repeating the message for them all to hear. [t]"We offer the promise of fresh food if your kind allow us passage through these tunnels. We will not harm your kin if you do not harm us. I only ask that you follow behind us enough to not get caught in any crossfire. Then you may have all the bodies that remain."
Narrator BOT 16-05-2023 19:21
Orion's telepathic message echoes in the minds of the troglodytes like a stone dropped into a still pond, the ripples expanding and causing a sudden mental stir. Five concealed troglodytes experience the invasion of the foreign voice in their minds, and in the wake of Orion's message, a stunned silence suffuses the cavern. Then, like a dam breaking, a tumultuous argument breaks out amongst the troglodytes, their guttural voices echoing off the cavern walls. The language is harsh and unfamiliar, but the sentiment is clear - conflict. Each of the six troglodytes contributes to the cacophony, their voices distinct in their intensity and conviction. Within this heated discussion, three of them seem to be swayed by Orion's promise, their voices rising in defense of the proposed agreement. The debate continues, the outcome yet uncertain.
Narrator BOT 16-05-2023 19:32
From the shadowy recesses of the cavern, a slight ripple runs through the stone. It's as if the rock itself breathes, and then a figure detaches itself from the wall. The troglodyte stands there, its skin shifting and morphing as it abandons its chameleon-like disguise. The grey tones of the cave wall recede, replaced by the muddy browns and mossy greens of its true skin. It steps out, tentatively, one clawed foot after another, into the dim light of the cavern. Its eyes, used to the darkness, blink rapidly in the relative brightness, its nostrils flaring as it sniffs the air. The troglodyte's beady eyes dart from one member of the party to another, scrutinizing them, trying to discern if the fleshwalkers' words hold truth. There's a tension in its posture, a readiness to spring back into the shadows at the first sign of danger. It's a test, a gamble. Yet, the promise of an easy meal and the novelty of this encounter make it a risk worth taking. The cavern falls into an uneasy silence as all eyes turn towards this brave, or perhaps foolhardy, creature.
Orion BOT 16-05-2023 19:51
I drop my own camouflage, revealing myself to the troglodytes, but I do not move from where I was just previously hidden, hoping the realization of where I was helps send the right message to them. [T] "I am the small insect-kind speaking to you all. I do not know your language. My companions do not either. We only ask for this truce between your kind and our party. We will not knowingly take anything from your mind, and you may follow at a safe distance to recover the easy meals that will be sure to develop from our exploration. If you agree, please nod."
Narrator BOT 16-05-2023 20:01
Caught off-guard, the troglodyte stumbles back, its eyes widening in surprise as the small insect-like being appears seemingly from nowhere. The party watches as a wave of awe washes over its features, an emotion that seems out of place on the typically savage creature. It's as if it has seen something truly wondrous, its gaze fixed on Orion's shifting carapace with a mixture of curiosity and respect. The creature turns its head, glancing back at its hidden kin, its sharp eyes scanning the shadows. Then, it looks back at Orion, the smallest hint of understanding dawning in its primitive mind. This was not a fleshwalker, nor a scaleskin. It was something... different. Slowly, carefully, it gives a single, deliberate nod. Its gaze never leaves Orion, the message clear in its eyes. It had heard his words, understood them, and agreed to their terms. The cave seems to breathe a collective sigh of relief as the tension begins to dissipate, the silent agreement of truce echoing throughout the cavern.
Orion BOT 16-05-2023 21:17
addressing only the party [t]"It looks like they will let us pass. Let's continue forward through the mountain, and try to hold good on our end of this truce. Preferably not with our own bodies."
Tavoros BOT 16-05-2023 21:54
"Lead on then Orion, we will follow your lead." Tavoros replies, maintaining his position at the rear of the group. (edited)
Orion BOT 16-05-2023 22:00
takes the lead, guiding the party through this portion of the tunnels
Liliana BOT 16-05-2023 22:01
Liliana follows, eyeing the Troglodytes supsiciously
Narrator BOT 17-05-2023 01:18
With the tentative agreement of the troglodyte, the party cautiously begins to move forward, their steps echoing softly in the sprawling cavern. The smell of damp stone and earth intensifies, mingling with the faint traces of animal musk and something else, a scent foreign and unfamiliar, as they delve deeper into the mountain. They wind their way through the craggy tunnels, the light from Igrim's lantern casting long, dancing shadows on the stone walls. The path is winding and narrow, twisting and turning in a seemingly random pattern, but they press on, guided by their collective sense of direction. Touched by the constant, gentle seep of water from the hillside above, an irregular cavern unfolds in a fantastical display of fungal life. A myriad of puffballs, their surfaces mottled and alien, dot the landscape alongside towering caps that stand sentinel-like amidst the bizarre tableau. Patches of mold, their colors a spectrum from sickly yellow to a vivid, almost unnatural, blue, spread across the stone in a fuzzy, mottled blanket. Dominating the southern portion of the chamber, a skeleton rests in eternal slumber, its form swathed in the golden-brown embrace of a mold carpet. The once proud mail armor it wears now lay rusted and corroded, a testament to the passage of time. Yet, in the skeletal hand, a sword of surprising brilliance gleams, its luminescence defiant and undimmed by the years. The light dances off the blade, casting flickering shadows that make the cavern's fungal residents appear to sway and shiver. Beyond the skeleton, the cavern narrows, leading to a smaller chamber just barely visible from the main room. The passageway, like the rest of the cavern, is adorned with the eerie beauty of the fungal life, a silent testament to the cavern's isolation from the world outside.
Liliana BOT 17-05-2023 09:49
"...so we can all agree the blade is likely magical, probably cursed and even if it isn't taking it from the skeleton is a hilariously crappy idea, yes?" Liliana quietly observes "And that there is about a 99% chance that we will do it anyway?" (edited)
Tavoros BOT 17-05-2023 09:53
"Well I mean it is very shiny!" Tav whispers back. "Still, I wouldn't want to disturb this mould, it can be quite horrible stuff, especially in this quantity." He thinks for a moment before remembering he has what he needs. "If we all stood back, I can try and retrieve the sword from a distance using my mage hand!" he says with excitement.

Narrator BOT 17-05-2023 14:41
Laurentina, her eyes glowing with an ethereal light after completing her ritual, casts her gaze around the strange, fungus-filled cavern. Her heightened senses, tuned to the ebb and flow of magic, sweep the room in search of any telltale spark of the arcane. But the fungal forest remains silent to her magical senses, devoid of any mystical aura save for the familiar signatures of her companions. Her gaze lingers on each of them for a moment, picking out the intricate weaves of magic that clung to their belongings - the faint hum of enchanted weapons, the subtle shimmer of protective amulets. But beyond them, the cavern remains an enigma, its secrets cloaked not in magic but in the more mundane mysteries of nature and time.
Narrator BOT 18-05-2023 01:19

Narrator BOT 18-05-2023 15:32
Tavoros, his keen eyes narrowing, takes a step closer to study the skeleton. The time-ravaged bones lay sprawled out on the floor, encased in a shroud of golden-brown mold. The once formidable figure now lay silent and still, forever entwined in a dance with the slow, relentless passage of time. As his gaze traverses the spectral figure, he discerns the ghostly outlines of the mail armor, now tarnished and rusted, clinging to the skeletal form. The eerie beauty of decay is all too apparent. What truly catches Tavoros' attention, though, is the sword that the skeleton tightly grasps. Gleaming brightly amidst the decay, the weapon seems untouched by time, its pristine condition starkly contrasting with the scene around it. However, the sword's size and ornate hilt suggest a certain heft to it, a weight that surpasses the abilities of a simple mage hand. Tavoros' experience as a wanderer and his connection with nature warn him of the potential hazard the mold presents. Such fungal growths often harbor defensive mechanisms, releasing clouds of spores when disturbed. The sword may be tempting, but retrieving it would necessitate caution and care, lest the quiet tomb of the fallen warrior unleashes a dangerous, spore-filled farewell.
Tavoros BOT 18-05-2023 15:51
"Hmm, on second thought, that sword looks far too heavy to lift from afar with my magic." he says having contemplated the scene. "And I really think we should avoid disturbing any of this mould, especially if we're close to it. Has anyone got any other ideas on how we might retrieve it? Or should we just move on?"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 18-05-2023 16:11
"I have this." Igrim pulls out a grappling hook attachment. "I can tie this to some rope and hook the sword over to us."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 18-05-2023 16:12
"You could use your magic hand to hook this around the sword." Igrim said as he helf out the grappling hook to Tavoros.
Tavoros BOT 18-05-2023 20:47
*Tavoros conjures his Mage Hand, visible to make it easier to see what he's doing to everyone else. He lifts the grappling hook with the rope attached, moves it forward until it's at a good angle to latch to the cross guard of the sword. When he's done he says,* "Pull now!"
Narrator BOT 18-05-2023 20:54
As Tavoros' words echo through the cavern, the spectral hand obediently positions the grappling hook over the cross guard of the gleaming sword. The grapple finds purchase, its curved hooks wrapping securely around the metal of the cross guard. The rope attached to it remains taut, the other end held firmly by the team in anticipation. At Tavoros' command, the group pulls in unison. The rope strains against the weight of the sword, tugging it from the skeletal grasp that has held it for what could have been centuries. The skeleton, disturbed but not entirely displaced, releases a puff of golden-brown spores. However, the distance the group maintains keeps them safe from the expected cloud. The gleaming weapon is dragged across the floor, leaving a trail in the mold, and comes to rest a safe distance away from its previous owner. The once quiet cavern resonates with the sound of the successful retrieval, a testament to the group's ingenuity and caution. The weighty sword now lies within their reach, the specter of the past giving way to the curiosity of the present.

Narrator BOT 19-05-2023 22:44
This great cavern glimmers with a faint phosphorescence. The ceiling is almost fifty feet overhead, and bright flecks and gleaming stone formations are visible in the distance. Patches of strange fungi dot the floor, including capped stalks standing as tall as a human and glowing puffballs almost a yard wide. High ledges rise fifteen to twenty feet above the floor on the north, south, and west walls. Narrow passageways lead off to the north and the south, and a flight of carved stone stairs descends from the western ledge to a path that meanders through the center of the chamber toward a small iron door in the eastern wall. Audible throughout the entire chamber is the sigh of a soft, cool breeze that rises toward the surface far above.

Narrator BOT 22-05-2023 12:42
With an assured grace, Laurentina stands before the imposing iron door, her eyes taking in the tarnished silver rune of Durgeddin and the rusted, riveted plates. She extends her hand towards the barrier, her fingers curled as if to knock on the door. Yet, she does not physically touch the cold, metallic surface. Instead, a soft murmur escapes her lips, forming an arcane incantation that fills the cavern with a palpable anticipation. An ethereal knock, resonating with unseen power, booms out from her outstretched fingers, echoing throughout the cavern. The door, strong in its fortitude and stoic against the passage of time, is coerced by this arcane intrusion. The iron plates, rusted and sturdy, groan and creak as the magical force lifts the seals that hold it shut. In response, the door swings open, its movement grating against the stony floor, yet conceding to the compelling command of Laurentina's magic. A gust of stale air rushes past, carrying the scent of unexplored depths and the promise of secrets long forgotten. There before the party, under the subtle power of Laurentina's spell, the iron sentinel of Durgeddin's mark has yielded, revealing the passage that lies ahead.

Narrator BOT 22-05-2023 13:10
The stairs end at the entrance to an octagonal chamber. The floor is inlaid with cracked, dusty blue tiles, and the walls are dressed with polished marble. Large doors of iron-bound oak exit to the northwest and northeast. Three cast bronze statues, almost ten feet tall, stand by the west, north, and east walls. Each depicts an armed dwarf. The eastern and western ones carry axes and shields. The center statue is armed with two axes. The ceiling rises in a dome almost thirty feet above the floor. From somewhere in the distance, you can hear the faint ringing of hammer on anvil.

Narrator BOT 22-05-2023 16:24
With her focused gaze, Laurentina examines the room meticulously, her eyes roaming from the towering bronze statues to the oaken doors and across the blue-tiled floor. She notes the faint trails in the dust that seemed to lead from the entrance stairs toward the statue in the east. Her keen senses also pick up on the faint, rhythmic sound of hammering, echoing from somewhere beyond the east wall. Her eyes then travel to the grandiose statues. The scuff marks around the edges of the doors do not escape her attention either. She discerns the small scorings on the floor in front of them, patterns consistent with axe strokes, indicating the doors aren't what they seem. Her gaze then drifts towards the arms of the statues. Amidst the exquisite detailing, she finds an anomaly - a faint line on each statue's arm, suggesting their ability to move.

Their attention piqued, they inspect further, their fingers tracing over the subtle line in the wall, discovering a concealed door tucked discreetly behind the statue.

In a surprising turn of events, as Laurentina applies pressure to the hidden door, it does not give way or swing open as she might have expected. A cloud of fine particulate matter billows out, momentarily obscuring her vision. When the dust finally settles, she finds herself not staring at a door, but a newly revealed stairway. Narrator BOT 24-05-2023 15:10
Just as Laurentina ascends, her foot pressing onto the halfway point of the stairs, an abrupt change sweeps over the atmosphere. A low, resonating hum fills the stairwell, followed by the activation of a hidden magical alarm. Out of thin air, a spectral, dwarven mouth forms, its ethereal lips moving in a language understood by few outside of the dwarven clans. In a booming, echoing voice, it calls out, (Dwarvish) "Alert! Alert! Intruders approach!" The words resonate throughout the chamber, serving as a warning of impending danger to any who could understand. The magical mouth fades as quickly as it appeared, leaving behind an uneasy silence as the warning reverberates through the hidden stairwell and up into the unseen areas of the fortress above.

Narrator BOT 24-05-2023 15:45
This enormous hall is lined with ten great pillars, carved into the forms of giants and dragons, that support the vaulted ceiling high above. Guttering orange torches set in sconces along the walls illuminate the room, and a mighty throne sits on a dais at the opposite end. The walls were once covered with tile mosaics, but they have been smashed and defiled by graffiti. Tiny fragments of tile litter the floor. You can see five other exits. A small fire smolders on the floor before the dais, where six sleeping pallets lie empty, surrounded by packs and supplies. The sound of hammers ringing on iron comes from beyond the doors to the south. Suddenly a harsh voice calls from the shadows of the pillars, ‚ÄúGo back the way you came! This is the only warning you‚Äôll get!‚Äù
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 24-05-2023 15:48
Igrim dips his head back out but yells back to the voice. "We're not looking for any trouble! Just answers." He draws an arrow from his quiver and lays it slack against the shaft of his bow.
Ghared BOT 24-05-2023 16:13
A scornful laugh echoes throughout the expansive hall, bouncing off the intricate stone pillars and resounding ominously around the room. The harsh voice responds, reverberating from somewhere within the shadows of the columns. The speaker is invisible yet undeniably present. "Answers, is it?" the voice sneers. "Strange way of asking, drawing your arrow like that! You barge into our stronghold, our sanctuary, and you expect us to believe you come in peace? Unlikely, stranger!" The voice drips with suspicion and wariness, threaded with a subtle undercurrent of hostility. However, no immediate aggression is apparent. It seems, for now at least, the dwarves are willing to entertain Igrim's claim.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 24-05-2023 16:18
"I draw arrows even on my allies, don't take it personally. I'm just careful. If we wanted to fight, then there would be no point in me talking right now." Igrim tries to locate where in the room the voice is coming from. "Upstairs, the first and second level of this stronghold was overtaken by orcs and troglodytes. Are they your allies?"
Ghared BOT 24-05-2023 16:30
The voice lets out a low, guttural grumble that might be a bitter laugh, reverberating in the shadows of the room. "Orcs and troglodytes are no allies of ours, stranger. They're pests, scavengers... trespassers, much like yourselves," *the voice replies. A moment of silence follows, then a soft snort. "Your arrow-drawing habit may be your way, stranger, but we dwarves have a habit of our own: not taking kindly to intruders." (edited)
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 24-05-2023 16:38
"Unlike your orcs and troglodytes, we have no intention of staying here longer than we have to. If you're telling the truth that you dwarves were the original residents of this stronghold then you'll want to know that the orcs have been cleared out and the troglodytes' numbers have somewhat dwindled." Igrim pauses for a second then continues. "I don't take kindly to strangers either so I'm well out of my comfort zone right now. But if you are who you say you are then I think we may be able to help each other."
Ghared BOT 24-05-2023 16:40
There's a coldness that seeps into Ghared's voice as she continues, "Did you not stumble upon the grand sepulchers up there? The resting places of our ancestors who died defending this stronghold? The tombs of Borgol the Old, Gharin Orc-Doom, and poor Numik the Unlucky. Their bones, their sacrifices, they're a testament to the bloody history of this place." A pause. "I hope you honored their resting places. For each stone, each carving, each artifact in their tombs, all tell a tale of valor, of dwarven resilience, of our loss. This is not just stone and metal to us. This is our heritage, and it demands respect."
Liliana BOT 24-05-2023 16:42
"As a matter of fact, I don't think we did. I hate to break it to you, but things have happened. To you and your beloved stronghold, specifically." Liliana pipes up "You're not in Faerun anymore, honey. and in this place you are the intrudes, so pardon us when we come to investigate"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 24-05-2023 16:46
"And really, we don't know your people nor your history. I have a feeling that you are a person who appreciates boldness so I will say this; I don't care why you want to protect this place but my friend is right. To us, you're no different from those orcs and troglodytes, the only difference lies in whether you will fight us or fight with us."
Ghared BOT 24-05-2023 16:56
Ghared's voice echoes back from the pillars, heavy with disbelief and a twinge of derision. "Not in Faerun? Hah! Next you'll be telling us the sky is green. We've lived in these halls for generations, and they've not changed, save for the unwelcome guests. You come barging into our home, talking about 'investigating', and have the audacity to call us intruders?" *A moment of silence ensues after her declaration. Then Ghared's voice rings out again, cold but pensive. "Oh, indeed?" Her tone is dripping with a mix of disbelief and curiosity. "We're no different from the filth who've infested our lands, are we? The very thought of it! How glib you are with your words, stranger, to dare to compare us with those brutes!" Her voice hardens with conviction, "Our ancestors spilled their lifeblood defending these halls. They held their ground, even as they were outnumbered, until their last breath. Yet, you march in here, comparing us to those savages who live for nothing but bloodshed." She takes a moment to let the gravity of her words sink in before continuing, her voice growing steely. "But, you're right about one thing, stranger. I am a dwarf who appreciates boldness. And it's because of that boldness that we've survived, that we've been able to protect what's ours." A hint of defiance seeps into her voice as she concludes, "And if it's a choice between fighting you or fighting with you, then know this‚Äîwe've fought harder battles than you can imagine. We'll not bend to threats or honeyed words. But if you prove yourselves worthy, if you show respect to our halls, our history...perhaps we can find some common ground."
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 24-05-2023 17:12
she looks at the group "I helped treat a few dwarves while i was at the chuch, they were always talking about payment in exchange, i would always have to talk them down, it was just charity work and they were free to donate. perhaps these dwarves are equally focused on money..."
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 24-05-2023 17:16
she steps forward not holding any weapons "Hello sir, I am Sister Laurentina of the church of Ilmater, i apologize on behalf of my companions here. We were tasked to investigate a new cave." she places her free hand across her chest "We did not mean to intrude and its clear you are noble and civilized compared to the others. Perhaps we can be of aid. We need to investigate, but perhaps there is some thing you need done, some treasure stolen that could be returned? we could help each other maybe?"
Ghared BOT 24-05-2023 17:37
A pause followed Laurentina's words, a silence that echoed in the vast hall, punctuated only by the distant, rhythmic hammering. "Hmm..." Ghared finally said, a new note of consideration in her voice. "Sister Laurentina of Ilmater, is it? A church woman in this forsaken place... how unusual. You speak with a soothing tongue, much unlike your friends." She let out a thoughtful sigh, "Yes... there might be something you can do. A deed, a show of goodwill. To the north of this hall lie chambers that have been overrun with the restless dead, remnants of a cursed past. They are a nuisance. Cleanse them, show us that your intentions are indeed pure, and we will discuss this further. Complete this task, and perhaps we can find that common ground you speak of, Sister Laurentina," Ghared finished. The last of her words echoed around the chamber, setting the terms of their unusual negotiation. (edited)
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 24-05-2023 17:45
"Hm. If we do this, what do we get? I'm not sure what exactly your 'goodwill' is worth or if it has any use at all." He twirls the arrow tauntingly around his fingers. "Common ground, in this case, means mutual benefit but so far, all that's been put on the table are benefits for you."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 24-05-2023 17:49
"A man once told me: 'Trust is a bad foundation for cooperation. A shared goal and a mutual benefit is unbreakable. Until, of course, the goal is attained and the benefit stops.'" He stops twirling the arrow. "I killed him and he's dead now but he had a point. Clearly, neither of us will ever fully trust the other, so what's the benefit?"
Ghared BOT 24-05-2023 18:06
The harsh voice that was Ghared takes a moment to respond, clearly considering Igrim's words. "A fair point, stranger. We duergar aren't well known for our generosity, but we're not without honor." There's a pause, as if considering the terms. "Rid us of the undead plague and we will grant you safe passage through our domains, unharmed and unchallenged. Plus, we've been here for a while, mining and smithing. We've unearthed a few treasures, things we can part with. We'll give you a token of our gratitude, something of value." The voice takes on a graver tone, "And who knows? You might find things in those cursed northern chambers worth more than gold. Also, as a token of our goodwill, we will answer any questions you have about this stronghold or the surrounding area. Knowledge can often be the greatest treasure of all. Are these terms acceptable to you?"
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 24-05-2023 18:11
"Oh, that is agreeable, i fear there is much undead that plague these lands. I have had to put a few to rest already. I would be happy to aide in this endeavor, then we can talk on more agreeable terms! We would like to know more about the cave network, it seems to have only appeared recently and we are here, so any information is welcome. I accept your kind offer. but i do not know your name" she smiles brightly
Ghared BOT 24-05-2023 18:14
Ghared's voice responds from the shadows, now carrying a tone of guarded respect. "I am Ghared, a watcher and protector of this stronghold. It seems we may find some mutual ground after all, Sister Laurentina. Accept our offer, and we'll see that both our ends are met. The undead that defile this place are to the north. Return when you have completed your task. Until then, walk safely and may your gods guide you." With these words, the echoes die down, and the grand hall returns to its previous, looming silence, save for the distant and faint ringing of hammer on anvil. You are still unable to see the source of the voice. You just know it is coming from behind a pillar.
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 24-05-2023 18:59

As you approach the large room with the dark pool, the sound becomes louder, more insistent, a spectral warning of an unseen presence. The rooms to your side bear the scars of violence and time, doors broken and splintered, the remains of once grand furnishings now nothing more than wreckage scattered across the stone floor. The pool at the end of the hallway glimmers ominously in the dim light, the source of the unnerving moans that fill the air with spectral echoes. (edited)

It's a sound that feels simultaneously far and near - the spectral rattle and hollow creaking of old, ethereal armor, untouched by the sands of time. Each movement, each step of the sound echoes with a chilling symphony of ancient battles, a ghostly clatter that seems to resonate from a realm not of this world. The clank of metal on metal rings out, each note hanging in the air longer than it should, as if the very sound was reluctant to fade. The spectral hiss of shifting chainmail, the hollow thud of spectral boot on stone - it all merges into a disturbing symphony that speaks of undying warfare and eternal restlessness.

Narrator BOT 30-05-2023 18:34
With Arundil's spectral form finally banished, the chaotic scene grows eerily quiet. All that remains of the intense battle are the crumbled skeletal remains and rusted plate armor of the six spectral dwarven soldiers. (passive perception of 15 or greater) You pick up on a distinct sound. The echo of footsteps, seemingly withdrawing from the scene of battle, can be faintly heard. They seem to be heading towards the main room, the place where you first heard the voice of Ghared.
Liliana BOT 30-05-2023 18:35
Liliana waits until the steps are far enough away before letting out a deep breath "I think we're done. Our watcher is backing off anyway... do we want to go back now or take a breather? a longer one?"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 30-05-2023 22:19
"Let's do that. I still don't trust them, they could be setting up an ambush for us right now so better if we're at our best." Igrim stowed away his longbow amd started gathering usable arrows. "I can do with just a short rest but you guys are the ones up front taking hits so I'll defer to your judgement."

gets her bandages out "They seem like nice people they wouldnt ambush us!" she says fully trusting them
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 31-05-2023 01:31
"Lots of bad people seem like nice people." Igrim sits down facing the door to the crypt with his longbow and an arrow set on his lap.

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 31-05-2023 06:37
"Mistaking a good person for a bad person won't hurt anybody. The other way around will get you killed. It's called being careful."
Narrator BOT 31-05-2023 16:23
This large chamber that confronts you carries an air of forgotten grandeur now marred by the stains of time and conflict. In the center, a dark pool of still water adds a touch of mystery to the room, its depths hidden in the gloom. The stillness of the water betrays no hint of what might lie beneath its opaque surface, but Igrim, with his honed senses and practiced eye, is confident that it conceals no traps or hidden dangers. Bits of smashed furniture are strewn about the floor, their original shapes and purposes barely discernible through the damage they've endured. These scattered fragments tell a silent tale of conflict and struggle, a stark contrast to the peace that the chamber now holds. Adding to the sense of desolation, other debris litters the room - fragments of stone from the walls, pieces of broken weapons, and unidentifiable detritus that once, perhaps, held some meaning for the room's occupants. Despite the clutter, Igrim is assured that they hold nothing of value, nor any additional threats. Flanking this central area, hallways stretch off to the east and the west, their stone floors worn smooth by the passage of countless feet.
Orion BOT 31-05-2023 16:44
"shall we continue east down this hall?" the small fighter asks his companions.
Liliana BOT 31-05-2023 16:45
"Do we have to? I think we might as well head back and report in. Looks like the job is done, right?"
Orion BOT 31-05-2023 16:49
[t]"We don't have to, was just a suggestion. I'm just enjoying exploring with you all and was looking forward to what might lie ahead. Reporting in sounds logical though."
Liliana BOT 31-05-2023 16:51
"Heh, right back atcha. Tell you what, let's just get the dwarf business out of the way and then see what else we can dig up in this place?"
Orion BOT 31-05-2023 17:02
nods in agreement
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 31-05-2023 21:48
Igrim does still approach the eastern room, not for the mission but just to sate his own curiosity. He quickly scours the room for any mechanically triggered traps and finds nothing. He takes a sniff of the air in the room and grimaces a little bit. "Stagnant water in a dungeon. Public health disaster right there." He steps back a little bit and faces the group. "Back to the dwarf then? We should be careful." He scoffs. "Good people don't tend to stalk people invisibly while they fight for their life."
Ghared BOT 01-06-2023 00:09
*As the party returns to the great room, the tension that once filled the air has notably diminished. Now, six duergar dwarves stand before the party, their bodies no longer concealed by the magic of invisibility. Their weapons, once a potential threat, are now peacefully sheathed, indicating their acceptance of the party's presence. Ghared, the harsh voice that had challenged and negotiated with the party previously, steps forward. Her voice, still rough from years of hardship, carries a newfound note of gratitude.* "Thank you for your assistance. We have been unable to reclaim that space for some time. We once called this cavern our home when we were grey dwarves. Our captivity and slavery to the Illithid was long and when we returned after escaping we found it in this ruin. We lost many fighting our way down here again and we are few in number now. Your assistance has been a great help to us." She then pauses, her gaze meeting each member of the party. "What information can we provide?" she asks, signaling their willingness to repay the party's help with valuable knowledge. This show of trust and cooperation is a stark change from their previous standoffish demeanor, a testament to the party's efforts in aiding the duergar.
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 01-06-2023 00:18
"It can hurt the person who is judged evil" She sighs as she sits down and pulls out a prayer book to read for the break
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 01-06-2023 00:23
bows politely "Helping is its own reward" she looks to the party "We are just scouting the cave, if you could tell us more about the network here. no one has seen it before in the lands and are wary of what darkness may hide in it"
Ghared BOT 01-06-2023 00:31
Ghared's voice wavers a bit, but she clears her throat and starts to speak. "It seems fair to exchange stories after your heroic actions. Let me tell you of Khundrukar, the stronghold you've so boldly ventured into." "Many years ago, this place was the pride and glory of Durgeddin the Black and his kin. Durgeddin was a master smith, famed far and wide for his craft. His blades were unmatched, desired by dwarves, humans, and even elves. But Durgeddin and his folk had a longstanding feud with the orcs and goblins of the mountains. When his clan was defeated and forced to scatter, Durgeddin led the remnants of his folk to these very mountains. It was here that they established Khundrukar, which we know as the Glitterhame." "Under the mountain, Durgeddin and his kin worked their craft, traded their wares, and lived in peace. However, such peace was never meant to last. Our enemies discovered our secret refuge, and they came with their weapons, their cruelty, and their hate. The fortress was besieged, my kin were slain, and Khundrukar was lost." "For centuries, the location of this fortress was forgotten. Now, it seems, it has been rediscovered. This stronghold was built for dwarves by dwarves, and I am the last remnant of the defenders that were. The legacy of Durgeddin and his kin lives on in the blades he forged and in the memories of those who remember the tales of Khundrukar." "There's more to this stronghold than meets the eye, places of natural beauty, a legendary forge, and deeper still, the darkest depths where an ancient evil lurks. This is the home you've stepped into, Sister Laurentina, a stronghold forged out of fury, its glory days long past but not forgotten."
Tavoros BOT 01-06-2023 18:29
"The legendary forge sounds interesting. Do you still have access to it? What sort of things did you make there?" Tavoros asks with intrigue. "On more practical matters, what will you do now we have rid this place of the Orcs and Goblins? Do you plan to rebuild and continue to live here? And how deep are we talking for this ancient evil?" Turning to the others, Tavoros adds, "that sounds a little beyond our brief, don't you think?"
Ghared BOT 01-06-2023 18:34
Chuckling lightly, though it echoes hollowly in the stone chamber. "Ah, the Great Forge. Yes, it remains deep within the stronghold, although none of us have been able to use it for centuries. Durgeddin forged his greatest works there, the blades that made his name a legend." "As for what's next, rebuilding would be a grand endeavor... and it may not even be possible. The glory of Khundrukar was built on the strength of a dwarven clan, but we are few are all that is left. However, the thought of seeing the forge alive with fire and creation once more is a tempting one." "As for the ancient evil, the depth isn't as concerning as what dwells in it. From what we understand, a young black dragon by the name Nightscale claimed the deepest parts of Khundrukar as her lair. If she still resides there, it would indeed be a task beyond your current brief. Dragons are not to be trifled with lightly, my friend." Looking back towards Tavoros, Ghared continues. "You've helped cleanse this stronghold of the orcs and goblins, a task we could not complete on my own. You've earned the right to investigate further, should you choose to do so. Just remember, every step you take deeper into Khundrukar, the dangers will only grow greater."
Orion BOT 01-06-2023 18:35
[tele to party]"Can you guys ask them if I may speak to them. I have a question, but I don't want to scare them. I've seen how people react to the telepathy of they aren't aware of it coming."
Liliana BOT 01-06-2023 18:36
"You got it" she turns to Ghared and jerks her thumb in Orions direction "My friend is going to talk to you, but he can't really speak out loud. So don't be spooked if you hear a voice in your head"
Orion BOT 01-06-2023 18:39
[tele to all]"Hello. You spoke of a dragon. I've only met 1 dragon in my lifetime, and they did not exist in the world I came from. The dragon I met was kind, and only cared for laying around the lake and fishing. You speak as though this dragon is dangerous. Could you provide more detail on it?"
Orion BOT 01-06-2023 18:40
waves as the thoughts enter the minds of the druegar.
Ghared BOT 01-06-2023 19:04
Giveing a slight start at the sudden telepathic contact, her face momentarily darkening. It's clear that the method of communication is deeply uncomfortable for her, likely due to her experiences with the mind-flaying Illithids. Still, she manages to compose herself and reply, her voice somewhat shaky. "Nightscale, as far as we know, is not the docile creature you describe. She's a black dragon, vicious and cruel. All dragons are capable of great destruction, but black dragons are known for their sadistic nature and utter lack of empathy. Nightscale took over Khundrukar after it fell, claiming the treasures and the forge as her own. She would be no easy adversary." She takes a deep breath and continues, more sternly. "I know your companion means no harm, but please... no more of this mind-speaking. It brings back memories best left forgotten." Ghared's brows knit together as she recalls her time as a prisoner. "The mind flayers... they stripped us of our privacy, of our thoughts. It was not just their words that infiltrated our minds. It was their presence, their control. We weren't just stripped of our secrets; we were stripped of our selves. We had no refuge, not even in our own heads." She stops, taking a shaky breath, her eyes far away. "Each thought that crossed our minds was laid bare before them, manipulated and twisted to their liking. We were their puppets, mere playthings. It's a feeling I'd not wish upon my worst enemy." Her gaze returns to the present, her expression hardened. "So, I beg of you, no more telepathy. It is a reminder too harsh for us to bear."
Orion BOT 01-06-2023 19:11
nods in understanding and agreement
Liliana BOT 01-06-2023 20:02
"You know... I can sympathise with that. And the dragon is certainly an issue, even in these lands. Which, speaking of, I was not lying. This entire cave system got shifted into a different world. Darker, gloomier, populated by monsters. Both good and bad ones." She looks awkwardly off to the side, rubbing the back of her head "Speaking of, can I ask for a small favour?"
Ghared BOT 01-06-2023 21:27
"Speak your mind."
Liliana BOT 02-06-2023 08:58
"A vial of blood. Doesn't need to be yours, anyone... sentient will do. I didn't have an opportunity to drink during the battles and ghosts don't exactly have any." She pauses for a bit, then sighs "I am one of the 'good' monsters, in case you couldn't tell. Well, I'm OK, I suppose."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 02-06-2023 09:15
"I had a guess but you're a vampire, huh? I met one other vampire but he was nowhere near as nice as you. He just watched while a bunch of wolves nibbled at me and some others." Igrim scratched the back of his head. "Anyway. I can give you some of my blood. A full vial should be enough right? 4 ounces shouldn't be too bad." He said as took out an empty vial that used to contain a healing potion.
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 02-06-2023 09:16

Liliana BOT 02-06-2023 09:20

Laurentina could do her divine thing and it would not affect me..." She stops, catching herself rambling and looks away "Sorry. Didn't mean to go off on you like that. Sore spot. If you... yeah, I would accept yours. Just... don't draw too much." A bit of a grin returns to her face "And hey. Honestly? I don't mind alcohol in my blood. As long as it's not cheap moonshine"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 02-06-2023 09:26

He took out a dagger and his lantern. "I'll try not to bleed out but it's fine, I'm sure I've spilled more blood than there is in my body at this point, what's a little more." He opens the lantern and runs the blade of his dagger along the flames to sterilize it. "Uhhh, is there a specific part you like your blood from? Is it like... meat? I don't know how this works."
Ghared BOT 02-06-2023 11:57

Ghared BOT 04-06-2023 03:52
"Your intentions might be well placed, but let me assure you, feeding the Troglodytes is the least of our concerns. Our people are struggling to secure enough food for ourselves in these harsh conditions. We can't afford to prioritize feeding a horde of those beasts."
Orion BOT 04-06-2023 07:14

Ghared BOT 04-06-2023 23:12
"If you venture deep enough, you will undoubtedly cross paths with Nightscale. That's her domain." Turning to look at Liliana just now realized the implications of something she said previously. "Wait, we are no longer in Faerun?" Ghared's face falls slack, her wide eyes staring at Liliana in disbelief. "That is a difficult concept to wrap my head around. How... how could such a thing be possible? The implications... it's just..." She turns to her companions, sharing a look of stunned silence with them. Then she looks back at Liliana, uncertainty and concern written on her face. "You speak of a darker world, full of monsters. It's hard to believe, even with all the horrors we've encountered here. Are you absolutely certain of this? That such a displacement of land, of an entire mountain, could be possible?"
Orion BOT 04-06-2023 23:21

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 04-06-2023 23:24
"Yes. All of us aren't from this world originally either. It looks like Liliana is from the same world as yours. But the rest of us are from different ones. Orion says his entire ship was pulled through some mist. I was in the middle of... business when I was suddenly pulled in through the same mist."
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 04-06-2023 23:26

Ghared BOT 04-06-2023 23:33
"I see... It's not a simple task to just 'get over it' as you say, but I understand the sentiment. Such is the nature of survival, adapting to the unexpected. And the unexpected, it seems, is our constant companion." She pauses for a moment, her gaze becoming distant as she absorbs the information. "We need to discuss this with our leader, Nimira. This changes things... changes everything." Looking back at the group, she offers a small, grateful smile. "But your offer of help against Nightscale, even amidst this... confusion, is appreciated. If you decide to take on the challenge, we could use every bit of help." "You are welcome to rest here. If you're going to venture down to confront Nightscale, you'll need your strength." She says, her tone turning serious. "That beast is not to be taken lightly." With that, she turns to her comrades, and they begin to move off to discuss the staggering revelations with their leader.
Orion BOT 04-06-2023 23:35

Narrator BOT 06-06-2023 00:13
As the party concludes their rest, the sound of footsteps echo through the cavernous space. Emerging from the shadows are Ghared and another dwarf woman, older and exuding a stern authority. She is introduced as Nimira, the leader of the stronghold's remaining dwarves.
Nimira BOT 06-06-2023 00:13
Steping forward, her gaze flickering over the group with a mix of skepticism and curiosity. "Ghared has told me of your deeds and your... unexpected news." Her brow furrows, a sign of the internal struggle to comprehend the magnitude of the situation. "Aye, we experienced a strange mist throughout the caverns a week ago. It didn't cause us harm, but its appearance was certainly... unnatural." Her gaze hardens as she takes a deep breath, preparing herself to speak her mind. "I've led my people through many difficult times, but this..." She shakes her head, "This transcends anything we've faced before. Despite the confusion and fear, we must remain resilient, and we are in your debt for your aid against our adversaries." "We've managed to survive this long, we'll manage this too. Whether it be in Faerun or in another world altogether. If you still wish to assist us, you are welcome here." "What can you tell us about this new world?"
Igrim Luxgarde BOT 06-06-2023 00:45
"Damp, dark, horrible, humid, undead everywhere. In my experience at least." Igrim said as he started to repack his equipment to start the day off.
Orion BOT 06-06-2023 01:04
starts chittering excitedly in thri-kreen, using all 4 hands do charade various adventures and areas within this realm. "Chitter chatter clicky clack clack click bleep bip cluuk chat chat chit clack"
Nimira BOT 06-06-2023 01:16
After exchanging bemused looks with Ghared at Orion's chittering, finally breaks into a small grin. "Ah, Ghared mentioned a telepath among you. I reckon this must be our talkative insect friend?" Her voice held a friendly jest. "Ghared told me how your communications are...unconventional," she continued, chuckling at the memory. "Don't worry, lad, I will work through it."
Orion BOT 06-06-2023 01:24
[tele to Nimira] "Thank you! My kind are not physically capable of producing speech beyond our own language. On my homeworld, the other races were very accustomed to our methods of communication. When the ship I worked on was pulled through the mists and I arrived here, I was very shocked to find so many people who were often scared and frightened when I attempted to speak to them. What your people suffered through is terrible, and I feel sorrow for you. Thank you for willingly opening yourself like this. I do appreciate it. I had some questions for you if we are to attempt to retake the forge."
Nimira BOT 06-06-2023 02:59
Clearly startled, flinches slightly as Orion's thoughts fill her mind. She takes a moment, exhaling a deep breath before finally responding. Her voice, though steady, is noticeably softer. "Aye, it's quite disconcerting, that telepathy of yours. Feels like I've a beetle scampering about in me skull. But I'll weather it. We Dwarves are made of stern stuff." She steadies herself and nods, her expression turning serious once more. "You've got questions, lad? Go ahead. It's only fair, after all you've done for us. I'll answer what I can."

Liliana BOT 06-06-2023 08:50

Nimira BOT 07-06-2023 01:00
Listens intently to Orion's mental queries. She strokes her chin thoughtfully, her brows furrowed, "A map, ye say? Hmm. I can provide ye with a rough layout of the lower caverns. We've done our best to map out the place, though there are sections that remain unexplored due to the pesky undead and dragon." She takes a moment to rummage through a nearby drawer, pulling out a worn piece of parchment covered in charcoal scribbles. It‚Äôs a rudimentary layout, but it gives the party a good sense of what to expect. "Traps, eh? Well, we've set a few of our own for security, but I wouldn't count on them being of much use against Nightscale. She's a cunning one, that dragon. As for the area around the forge, well... it's not like we've had the chance to get down there and set any, what with the dragon and all." Nimira looks back at Orion, her gaze firm and resolute. "I can show you a secret route that leads to the forge. It's safer, relatively speaking. But avoiding the dragon entirely... that, I'm afraid, might be impossible. She's claimed the forge as her lair. And dragons, as you might know, are territorial creatures."
Orion BOT 07-06-2023 01:53
[tele to party and Nimira]"I do not intend to avoid the dragon, but rather lure it into an ideal location to fight it. Somewhere that it cannot fly, but will allow us to spread out to avoid its dangerous breath attacks."
Nimira BOT 07-06-2023 02:00
"That's a sound plan, indeed. Nightscale dwells in a large cavern with a deep pool, from where it usually launches its attacks. However, there are several side tunnels in that cavern that might serve your purpose. They're narrow, but they should be large enough for your group, and they would restrict Nightscale's movements." She gives Orion a firm nod. "It's a good plan. But remember, dragon's aren't just brute strength and terrifying breath weapons. They're cunning creatures, with keen senses. You'll need to be equally clever to lure Nightscale into your trap."
Orion BOT 08-06-2023 02:12

Tavoros BOT 08-06-2023 08:32

"If we can somehow find a way to fully surround the beast, we might be able to not let it get height or distance away from us, and with the element of surprise we might be able to injure it quickly before it can respond."
Liliana BOT 08-06-2023 08:36

Tavoros BOT 08-06-2023 14:13

Orion BOT 08-06-2023 14:14

Narrator BOT 08-06-2023 15:03
As Nimira guides the group through an intricate network of hidden passageways, she finally brings them to the brink of an enormous chasm. An old, somewhat precarious chain ladder disappears into the inky darkness below.
Nimira BOT 08-06-2023 15:03
Motions towards the ladder. "Down there," she yells over the cacophony of water. "That's where you'll find your adversary."
Narrator BOT 08-06-2023 15:03
*The sight before the party, however, is only fully available to those gifted with darkvision. For those without, the world beyond the chasm remains shrouded in an impenetrable veil of obscurity. To their enhanced eyes, the chamber below is a spectacular display of nature's power and primal beauty. A waterfall, thunderous and fierce, cascades down from an unseen height, its spray filling the air with a cool, refreshing mist. The water collects in a pool, swirling and churning, before flowing out to a larger river towards the north. The roar of the waterfall fills the chamber, its deafening sound echoing off the stone walls. A broad ledge can be seen leading away to the north, curving out of sight to the east. The mud on the bank of the pool has been disturbed, the imprints of tracks suggesting the presence of a significant creature. The scene has an aura of primeval majesty, but also a potent sense of danger. Whatever lies in the darkness beyond is unlikely to give up its lair without a fight.*
Liliana BOT 08-06-2023 15:05
"Can't say I have been expecting it to look so... impressive" Her catlike eyes penetrate the gloom as she observes "All right, let's see..." Looking around she searches for a good spot to set the planned Ambush
Orion BOT 08-06-2023 16:21
[tele]"Where is the forge located?"
Nimira BOT 08-06-2023 16:23
"On the island in the center of the lake where the dragon has claimed its horde."
Orion BOT 08-06-2023 23:37
nods [t]"Thank you. Let us scout a little, and take up our ambush positions, my friends." (edited)
Narrator BOT 09-06-2023 00:51
The sight of the rapid river coursing its way from west to east through the cavernous darkness immediately grabs the party's attention. Its ferocious current emits a powerful roar that competes with the resounding waterfall in the symphony of this underground ecosystem. The bottom of the chain ladder the group has descended is situated close to the southern bank of this subterranean river. A robust stone bridge spans over the river's foamy waves, leading to a ledge on the northern side. This path continues eastward, invitingly. As Orion ventures ahead, crossing the first bridge with confidence, the path alters its course. The ledge veers from the east towards the south, and a second bridge comes into view, crossing the wild river once more. However, this eastern bridge, the second one, has seen better days. Unlike the sturdy construction of the first bridge, this one appears precarious. Some of its stone blocks have settled at alarming angles, leaning out over the rushing water below, as if on the brink of tumbling into the river's depths at any moment. The stone itself, too, holds a peculiar characteristic ‚Äî it appears pitted, the surface marred by countless tiny indentations, as if eaten away by some relentless force. (edited)
Orion BOT 09-06-2023 01:51
moves quietly as possible across the bridge, doing his best to stay hidden and out of sight as he moves to take the ambush position. (edited)
Tavoros BOT 09-06-2023 04:12
Tavoros follows Orion lead and follows him forward, also taking care to stay hidden as best he can. (edited)
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 10-06-2023 08:27
she glances over her vision being much farther than the others seeing all the indentations, her scale mail scraping under her robes as she clumsily follows, up until she bumps into Igrim, only now realizing they cant see. She whispers as her hand glows with moon light as she touches the back of his head passing her gift of sight onto him "Sorry Igrim i forgot"
Orion BOT 10-06-2023 13:41
[t]"The bridge has been damaged by acid. The structure is unstable, and will likely collapse on itself if too much weight is on it."
Tavoros BOT 10-06-2023 22:58
"I should be light enough, I'll give it a try." Tav responds before quick-stepping his way across the precarious bridge.
Liliana BOT 11-06-2023 07:41
"Same here. Lauren, maybe see if you can cross along the Ceiling?" Liliana cautions before carefully attempting to cross
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 11-06-2023 10:14
blinks in surprise at the casual mention of it "I-I can t-try" She peeped out meekly as she looked up ag the walls and ceiling to try and find a way across
Narrator BOT 11-06-2023 13:59
Orion, the nimble Thri-kreen, is the first to approach the damaged bridge. He, unlike his companions, is not burdened by heavy armor. Light and agile, he seems a natural choice to test the bridge's stability. He sets a foot on the precarious construction, each of his steps measured and careful. The creaking of the worn-out stones is almost drowned out by the rushing river below. Despite the unstable appearance and threatening lean of the bridge, it holds. No stones give way, no blocks tumble into the water below. Orion successfully makes it to the other side. The bridge, though worn and perilously weathered, has withstood its first trial. Having observed Orion's successful crossing, Tavoros steps onto the precarious bridge, clad in his serpent scale armor. His stealthy background as a rogue, combined with his fighter's determination, lends him a degree of grace and precision that most others would find hard to match. His movements are measured, an exercise in balance and finesse, as he carefully places his boots on the uneven stone. However, despite his deftness, the pitted and worn bridge betrays him. A handful of small pebbles shift underfoot, tumbling from the bridge and cascading into the fast-moving river below. The gentle pitter-patter of the falling stones is swallowed up by the thunderous roar of the water, a subtle reminder of the bridge's unstable condition. Yet, despite this small mishap, the bridge remains intact, and Tavoros navigates the crossing successfully, his armored figure emerging from the other side without further incident.
Narrator BOT 11-06-2023 13:59
Unarmored and light on her feet, Liliana approaches the bridge next. With the natural agility and grace of a monk, she moves onto the unsteady structure. Her movements are as fluid as water, a studied choreography of footsteps, as she quietly traverses the bridge. Liliana's stealthy approach proves beneficial in this precarious situation. Her unarmored state, combined with the monk's discipline and agility, allows her to distribute her weight efficiently, preventing the bridge from shifting dangerously under her. With each careful step, the bridge holds steady beneath her. Small pebbles shuffle under her feet, echoing Tavoros' crossing, but she makes it across safely without causing any further damage to the already weakened structure. The sight of Liliana reaching the other side, just as unscathed as the two before her, seems to breathe a sense of relief into the rest of the party.
Narrator BOT 11-06-2023 14:11
As Igrim moves to cross next, he opts for a different approach. A strategy driven more by speed than stealth, he sprints onto the bridge, the clatter of his serpent scale armor echoing around him. The bridge groans and shifts under the force, its integrity put to a true test. Stones, larger than the pebbles dislodged before, tumble from the structure and drop into the torrential river below. The echo of their splash joins the cacophony of the rushing water. Igrim's heart pounds as fast as his feet against the stone, his sprint not just a test of speed but a gamble against the bridge's precarious stability. The bridge quakes under his weight, but ultimately, it holds. He reaches the other side, heart pounding, the faintest hint of a triumphant grin on his face. However, the moment is short-lived. Through the enhanced vision granted by Laurentina's Eyes of Night spell, Igrim spots movement in the water. Dark figures slide off the island in the lake, leaving trailing ripples in their wake as they submerge. The figures are heading directly towards the party, their intent unknown but their approach undeniably ominous. The respite offered by the bridge's survival is replaced with a new and pressing threat.
Narrator BOT 11-06-2023 15:23
Laurentina steps up to the threshold of the bridge, her gaze falling on the unsettling sight before her. The bridge, now shifted from its original position due to the collective weight of her comrades, presents a daunting task. Its precarious nature causes her to pause, uncertainty knitting her brow as she evaluates the risk. She does not step onto the bridge. Instead, her eyes wander to the cavern walls, her mind churning over another possibility. As a Dhampir, she possesses the remarkable ability to climb walls and ceilings much like a spider, a skill that may come in handy in a situation such as this. She glances from the bridge to the wall and back again, weighing her options. As her turn ends, she remains at the threshold of the bridge, her thoughts consumed with devising a safe path across.
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 11-06-2023 15:28
"Oh dear... I am on the wrong side of the wall... It may take me a while to get over there..." Is standing sideways panicking slightly as she should have gone back around onto the other wall...
Narrator BOT 11-06-2023 15:47
Igrim's warning is clear and carries a note of alarm, "Heads up! Something big and a couple of smaller things just slipped into the water from the island. They're moving fast and coming our way. Nobody go into the water and brace yourselves if you're on the bridge!"
Orion BOT 11-06-2023 17:55
hunkers down in anticipation for the incoming dragon
Tavoros BOT 11-06-2023 19:51
Nervousness builds in Tavoros as the water starts to ripple and the sound of creatures in the water can be heard. In anticipation of a fight, he focuses his mind on the Rune that adorns his cloak and, as if something is clicking into place, he suddenly grows several feet and looks significantly thicker. Knowing a distraction might be very useful, he reaches into his bag of tricks and pulls out a sacrificial lamb...or rather goat, but either way it feels very appropriate.

Igrim Luxgarde BOT 13-06-2023 00:37
"Here we go." He backed up into a wall as he nocked an arrow into his bow as his eyes focused on the subtle movement he saw in the water, readily waiting for any of them to leap out.
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 13-06-2023 04:10
is doing her best to balance on the wall "Uhm did you see something?"
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 13-06-2023 05:27
looks for a small object to cast the light spell on then holds it out over the water
Narrator BOT 13-06-2023 12:26
As the soft murmur of the spell passed Laurentina's lips, a warm, gentle light enveloped the object in her hand, immediately banishing the obsidian blackness that had once swallowed the cavern. For a moment, the party squinted and blinked as their eyes adjusted to the sudden illumination. A vibrant spectrum of color bled back into their world, replacing the stark monochrome of their darkvision. With the light now permeating every crevice of the cavern, an ominous sight presented itself. There, in the once obscured depths, a medium-sized figure glided ominously towards them, its black scales visible even from the depth of about ten feet below the water's surface. The tangible sense of menace now felt all the more immediate under the clear light, as the party braced themselves for what was to come.
Narrator BOT 13-06-2023 12:37
As the surface of the water began to churn, the figure revealed itself as Nightscale, the black dragon, her scales glistening menacingly under the light. With a deep inhale, she reared back, then released a jet of corrosive acid from her gaping maw, aimed directly at Tavoros and the summoned goat. The goat, caught directly in the onslaught, let out a bleat of distress before it was enveloped by the acid. Its flesh dissolved quickly, the raw, acrid smell of it mingling with the cavern's damp scent. In mere moments, the goat was reduced to nothing, its existence erased as thoroughly as if it had never been. Meanwhile, Tavoros managed to dodge partially, agility coming to his aid. The acid splashed against him, his flesh searing with the contact. It was a testament to his resilience that he remained standing, though the pain was evident on his face. The dragon's attack had found its mark, but Tavoros was far from beaten.
Liliana BOT 13-06-2023 12:38
As soon as the dragon pops out of the water, Liliana lets out a hissing curse, popping off a shot with her crossbow "You're one ugly motherf..."
Alnak-nik BOT 13-06-2023 12:56
Narrator: As the goat's life extinguished, the water surrounding its disintegrated form churned violently, revealing another threat. A black dragon wyrmling, medium in size and terrifying in its juvenile ferocity, emerged from the water. It filled its young lungs before exhaling a corrosive cloud of acid, smaller than its mother's but potent all the same, directed at Liliana. Liliana stood as the acid breath enveloped her, her clothing and skin blistering under the harsh onslaught. The corrosive element ate through fabric and flesh, yet she maintained her battle stance, a testament to her fortitude and unyielding spirit. With a turbulent splash, a second black dragon wyrmling launched itself from the depths, wings beating powerfully to lift its body into the air. Its reptilian eyes focused on Laurentina, who was adhered to the cavern wall like a spider. With a guttural snarl, the hatchling exhaled a plume of acid, a lesser echo of its mother's destructive capability, yet dangerous nonetheless. Laurentina was caught mid-climb, the corrosive mist striking her full on, searing her clothing and skin in a painful, corrosive touch. She winced, the impact of the attack visible but her resolve clear as she held firm to her position on the wall. (edited)
Narrator BOT 13-06-2023 13:01
With a keen eye and a deft hand, Liliana let loose the bolt from her crossbow. The arrow soared through the air, piercing the darkness and finding its mark on Nightscale. The dragon let out a roar of pain as the bolt sunk deep into her black scales.
Nightscale BOT 13-06-2023 13:01
Nightscale's menacing eyes flicked to Liliana, acknowledging the wound. "Well struck," the dragon spat out, her voice a vicious hiss echoing throughout the cavern. "But you will find it's going to take more than that to bring me down. My children and I are hungry, and you all will make a tasty feast." The sound of Nightscale's voice echoed off the cavern walls, momentarily drowning out the rushing water. The glint of satisfaction in Liliana's eyes was almost as sharp as her aim. Despite the dragon's imposing presence and ominous words.

Nightscale BOT 13-06-2023 15:15
*Breaking the water's surface with a powerful sweep of her wings, Nightscale rocketed upwards, hovering in the air momentarily before launching herself at the giant form of Tavoros. With an almost gleeful snarl, Nightscale lashed out with her claws twice in quick succession. The attacks were ferocious, but Tavoros managed to evade both, his quick reflexes serving him well despite his enlarged form.* "You are a large one," Nightscale hissed at Tavoros, her eyes gleaming maliciously in the flickering light of the cavern, "You will feed my brood well. And your possessions, your shiny trinkets... they will make a fitting addition to my horde." Her voice echoed with a predatory excitement, reveling in the thought of the fight to come. (edited)
Narrator BOT 13-06-2023 15:21
The two hatchlings, driven by instinct and the presence of their mother, launched their attacks. The first hatchling snapped its jaws at Liliana, who nimbly sidestepped its attack, leaving the creature's teeth to snap shut on empty air. The second hatchling, having taken flight, swooped down between Orion and Igrim. It lashed out at Orion with its teeth, aiming to snatch him up. However, the Thri-kreen's alien agility proved to be a worthy adversary. With a swift sidestep, Orion evaded the creature's attack, and the hatchling found itself with a mouthful of nothing but air. Even though their attacks had missed, the hatchlings' presence added a new level of urgency to the fight. These young creatures, while inexperienced, still posed a considerable threat.
Orion BOT 13-06-2023 15:45

Tavoros BOT 13-06-2023 15:59

Nightscale BOT 13-06-2023 17:25
*As the party engaged in the frenzied combat, Nightscale took a legendary action. She whipped her tail towards Liliana, attempting to sweep her off her feet. However, Liliana's reflexes were quick, and she leapt back, avoiding the sweeping tail that cut through the air where she had been moments before. Nightscale's body writhed, the fiery shackles that Tavoros had placed upon her searing her black scales. She let out a furious roar that echoed throughout the cavern, the sound of her pain and rage reverberating against the stone walls. Struggling against her bonds, her raw, draconic power burst forth, shattering the shackles that held her. Acid dripped from her maw, sizzling as it fell into the water below, a stark reminder of the deadly breath weapon she possessed. The burning, sizzling droplets served as a chilling reminder of the lethal capabilities of this formidable foe.* (edited)
Narrator BOT 13-06-2023 17:25
*Trapped within Orion's vice-like grip, the hatchling contorts its serpentine body, straining to free itself. With a sudden, frantic twist, it manages to swing its head around, baring its teeth at Orion. The sight is almost comical for a moment, a picture of desperation and indignation. But then the hatchling bites down, its teeth sinking into Orion's chitinous exterior. The bite is surprisingly forceful, a stinging reminder that, even when cornered, the hatchling is far from helpless. Suddenly, an intense burning sensation follows the sharp pain of the bite. Orion's chitin sizzles and hisses as the hatchling's corrosive saliva starts eating into his chitin, a cruel reminder of the deadly acidic nature of this beast's venom.* (edited)
Orion BOT 13-06-2023 18:19

Orion scurries over to Nightscale and attempts to punch her, but still can't figure out these magical tendrils. Orion then attempts to jump onto the dragon, but she blasts him away with a powerful smack of her wing.*
Nightscale BOT 13-06-2023 19:03
*With a sudden explosive force, Nightscale unfurls her massive wings and beats them downwards. The sheer power creates a gust so strong it sends a shockwave outwards, hitting both Liliana and Orion with the full brunt of the turbulent wind. The ground beneath their feet quakes and shivers, dust and pebbles kicked up into the air. Both Liliana and Orion are caught within the dangerous radius, their forms shrouded by the dust cloud for a brief moment. But then, out of the turbulent haze, they emerge, having managed to maintain their footing against the powerful force. Nightscale, meanwhile, harnesses the recoil of her wingbeat to propel herself upwards. Just as Nightscale takes a mighty flap back with her expansive wings in preparation for take-off, a figure rushes forward from her periphery. It's Liliana, nimble and focused, taking advantage of the dragon's temporary lapse in attention. With a swift motion, the monk strikes, her fist connecting with a solid hit to Nightscale's underbelly. The attack lands with a bone-jarring thud, the force enough to momentarily stun the mighty beast. With a cry of surprise, Nightscale's wings falter, her planned ascent abruptly halted. She falls backwards into the lake causing a wave of water to splash in all directions. Her massive form begins to sink into the deep, churning waters below, the waves swallowing her up in their dark embrace.* (edited)

Liliana BOT 14-06-2023 14:01
*while her companions one after another dive in and out, Liliana remains in the dark water, her eyes glued to the massive dragon that is slowly sinking away from her. It was almost laughable to remember that some time ago, the sheer idea of a dragon would have scared her shitless. She had heard the stories, seen the burned down villages. As a soldier, she never would have even dreamt of going up against it... but now? She was a monster. A monster made to hunt bigger, badder monsters. And the black mass under her was just that - another monster to fall to her blade The monk stretches out, darting down after the sinking foe as she goes to put it out of its misery. the first strike, slowed by the murky water, hits a scale and slightly cracks it, not damaging the flesh underneath. Remembering not to curs she flips the blade around, takes aim... 'Good night, you scaly bastard' Flashes through her mind as she stabs down, right through the cracked scale, and plunges the blade deep in its heart. She twists it, her purple gaze unfaltering as she watches the dragons death throes for a second... then pushes herself off the lifeless carcass and launches herself back to the surface, breaking through the water and looking at the others with a smug grin* "I really hope one of you brought a towel."
