Narrator BOT 14-06-2023 14:37
After the intense battle, the adventurers find themselves on the edge of the lake, each gasping for breath as the water calms from Nightscale's final plunge. With renewed determination, they dive into the cold, inky depths, pushing through the water towards the small island in the center of the lake. Emerging onto the island's shore, they are greeted by the sight of an ancient, unlit forge. The air is thick with the scent of abandonment and forgotten history. The forge, once a testament to centuries of skilled craftsmanship, now stands silent and unused against the stark backdrop of the cavern. Adjacent to the forge lies a sizable hoard, the accumulated wealth of Nightscale's centuries of plunder. Mounds of silver and gold coins gleam faintly in the muted torchlight, each piece a testament to a defeated foe or a pilfered hoard. Scattered amongst the coinage, precious gems catch their eye. Two garnets, their deep red hue capturing the last glimmers of light, and a black pearl, its glossy surface as dark and mysterious as the dragon who once collected them. Among the treasure are several items that emanate an unfamiliar, pulsating energy - indicative of magic. There is a wand, simple yet laden with an unseen power. A large axe, boasting a beautifully crafted blade, sits beside a shield, its polished surface reflecting the flickering torchlight. Amidst the wealth, they also spot two small vials, their contents unknown, but the glint in the liquid promising some form of magical properties. Yet, their exact nature remains unknown, further investigation needed to reveal the secrets of their power. The wealth, once the property of Nightscale, now lies in the hands of her vanquishers - their reward for their bravery and strength in the face of such a formidable adversary.
Tavoros BOT 14-06-2023 14:59
The gemstones catch Tavoros' eye the most, so he moves over to them to get a better look.
Orion BOT 14-06-2023 15:02
pays little attention to the item's strewn around, instead focusing on the forge itself, inspecting its craftsmanship and how it works.
Liliana BOT 14-06-2023 15:03
Liliana has her trophy, so an additional one is not interesting for her... but she does try to estimate just how much cash they have on their hands here
Liliana BOT 14-06-2023 15:31
After some time counting - check another vampire cliche off the list - she looks at the rest and lets out a low whistle "So, we have slightly over two grand here. Fourteen hundred and a few in gold and another six hundred gold in silver coins*
Tavoros BOT 14-06-2023 15:33
"There's probably a few hundred in the gems too if we can sell them. I'm not quite sure but they look like they're worth something."
Tavoros BOT 15-06-2023 20:30
"That axe, anyone want to claim it?" Tavoros asks, and is met by shaking heads in response. "I suggest we leave it with the Dwarves. I know we have a claim to this here gold, as we liberated it from the Dragon ourselves, but they have been through a hardship and it may be of sentimental value to them."
Narrator BOT 15-06-2023 20:49
Orion's attention is firmly fixated on the ancient forge. As a seasoned carpenter, his craftsmanship skills and appreciation for finely crafted objects make him keenly aware of the artistry and dedication embodied in this ancient structure. The central hearth, made from enduring stone and designed to endure intense heat, is monumental. Even though Orion's expertise lies in woodworking, he can't help but admire the craftsmanship that went into designing this fireplace. The bricks have been expertly laid, each piece fitting perfectly with the next, the flue designed for optimal airflow, all hinting at a profound understanding of material science and thermodynamics. Even though the forge hasn't seen the lick of a flame for centuries, its potential is palpable. The anvil sits silent and still, bearing a testament to the time when the rhythmic sound of a hammer striking metal filled these halls. The forge might be designed for a different craft, but the principles remain the same - dedication, precision, and creativity. Orion can't help but appreciate it, his fingers tracing the surface of the anvil and the worn handle of the bellows. He can almost feel the echo of the dwarven hands that once worked here, their legacy embodied in the still-standing forge.
1
Orion BOT 16-06-2023 01:40
admires the expert craftsmanship [t] "Let's get back to the dwarves. I'm sure they will want to know about this. I hope they can restore this forge to life."
Liliana BOT 16-06-2023 07:33
"They better." She glances over to the bridge and groans "Hey, Lauren, the Ceiling idea worked? Looks like I'll need to do that as well this time"
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 16-06-2023 15:15
follwoing along "Huh. What? you can walk along the ceiling too?" she seems very surprised as far as she knew it was some weird curse she had, maybe she has no real idea of what she is
Narrator BOT 16-06-2023 16:17
In the gloom of the cavern, the party carefully retraces their steps towards the dwarves. The precarious bridge looms ominously ahead, its frailty now all too apparent. Orion, lithe and unarmored, moves cautiously over the worn stone, his light steps causing minimal disturbance as the bridge resolutely bears his weight. Laurentina and Liliana, empowered by their Dhampir nature, embrace the sheer cavern walls, their bodies moving unnaturally over the vertical surface as if it were a simple stroll on level ground. Their passage is a shadowy ballet, played out on the stone canvas of the cavern. Igrim and Tavoros stand before the challenge of the bridge, their combined weight a potential downfall. But necessity is the mother of invention, and Tavoros, with a determined gaze, taps into the fey magic coursing through his Eladrin veins. In the blink of an eye, the air around them shimmers, and both he and Igrim vanish, only to reappear on the other side of the treacherous bridge, their feet planted firmly on solid ground. Leaving the treacherous bridge behind, they press on towards the ladder and begin their ascent, their bodies aching from the exertion and the thrill of the encounter still pumping through their veins. As they reach the top, they find the duergar leader, Nimira, her features molded into an expression of pure astonishment as she beholds their triumphant return.
4
Tavoros BOT 16-06-2023 16:55
His pockets bulging under the weight of the coins, Tavoros sees her astonishment and starts to explain. "We were successful in our endeavours! The black dragon (and her offspring, of which she had two) will no longer be bothering you. They sit at the bottom of the lake, and Liliana here made sure of the matter!" he says, gleefully.
Liliana BOT 16-06-2023 16:55
"It was a team effort. But yes, ding-dong the dragon is dead. Rejoice one and all."
Nimira BOT 16-06-2023 17:14
Nimira's initial astonishment gives way to disbelief. Her eyes flicker between the members of the party as she takes in their words. Her lips move, forming silent questions before finally finding her voice. "You...you faced Nightscale...and won?" she asks, her voice barely a whisper. "I thought...we all thought... it was an impossible task. But you...you've done it." Her gaze drops to the bulging pockets and then travels back up to meet their eyes. "You have our deepest gratitude. You have done something far beyond what we ever imagined possible. We are in your debt, a debt we can never hope to repay."
Orion BOT 16-06-2023 17:46
waves to the druegar woman in an attempt to prepare her for the mental message she is about to receive [T]"I do not speak for the others, but I do have 2 requests. Restore the forge to its former glory and use it to craft masterpieces once again. Also, the troglodytes that live in the more cavernous regions can be useful allies. I ask that you at least attempt a peaceful relationship with them. They respond well to offers of food and sustenance, and respect strength and cunning in the hunt."
Nimira BOT 16-06-2023 17:51
*Nimira's stern features soften as Orion's message reverberates in her mind. Her eyes take on a distant look, as if staring into the echoes of the past. The weight of centuries bear heavily on her, but his words ignite a spark in her eyes. It's as if his simple request had revived a part of her that she thought long dead. The forge - once the heart and soul of this cavernous complex - could once again roar with life, echoing the steady rhythm of hammer and anvil. When Orion mentions the troglodytes, she blinks, taken aback. The creatures had been a thorn in their side, but she couldn't deny the wisdom in his words. An ally in these dark depths would not be unwelcome, and if food and strength were the coin they respected, it was worth the attempt. Finally, her gaze refocuses on Orion, the faintest of smiles playing on her lips. In her gruff, deep voice, she replies,* "Ye've done us a great service, friends. It'd be only right to honor your requests. The forge will see life again, I swear it. And the troglodytes... we'll try to build bridges, not walls. I can't promise peace, but I can promise an attempt." Her gaze turns towards the darkness of the tunnel leading to the forge, her mind already spinning with the possibilities. The glow in her eyes is one of renewed determination. It is a daunting task, but it is a future worth fighting for. (edited)
Orion BOT 16-06-2023 17:55
nods, his bug-like alien face contorted in a way that makes it look very odd, but almost looks like a smile, as though he is very pleased with the woman's response.
Liliana BOT 16-06-2023 17:56
"And if they do decide to be a pain in the ass, well... we gave them a thrashing once. Would not hurt doing it again, if needed"
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 16-06-2023 17:57
"Oh i hope not... have they not surffered enough?"
Liliana BOT 16-06-2023 17:57
"Man, you really are a cinnamon roll, huh?"
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 16-06-2023 18:02
pouts "They didnt even try and hurt us... what if they are nice and we are the monsters for hurting them!" extra pouty her eyes glisten slightly
Liliana BOT 16-06-2023 18:04
Liliana sighs and puts her hand on Laurens shoulder "Hun... they did very much refuse to talk and try to kill us the first time. But don't worry. Unless they become a nuisance they have nothing to fear."
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 16-06-2023 18:06
looks down "Oh... I only saw the bodies..."
Orion BOT 16-06-2023 18:17
[t]"I believe they were only acting to defend and feed themselves. I hold no grudge against them for their actions."
Nimira BOT 16-06-2023 23:21
Nimira raises an eyebrow, her sharp features etched with curiosity. Turning towards Orion, she folds her arms over her chest and asks. "Communication is key to peace, yet the language barrier could present a challenge. The troglodytes' tongue is beyond my ken and, I presume, most of ours as well. How do you suggest we bridge this gap?" Her question hangs in the air, a practical concern amidst the hope and promise of rebuilding.
Orion BOT 16-06-2023 23:30
folds his arms in concentration, face scrunched up as he ponders this very valid question.
Orion BOT 16-06-2023 23:32
[t]"I have no ties to this land, and nothing in the cities to go back to. I am capable of communicating with the troglodytes. I could be your voice to them as new bridges are established."
Narrator BOT 17-06-2023 15:54
*The party, having completed their mission and leaving the forge in the hands of the astonished duergar, retraced their steps through the winding, subterranean passages. Up through the secret tunnels and into the open air of the mountain once more, the daylight that should have greeted them was nowhere to be found. Instead, the world was enveloped in an oppressive, misty gloom, robbing the sky of any hints of sunlight. The mountain peaks that should have been touched by the soft golden light of the setting sun, were instead cloaked in shadows, lost in the murkiness. They made their way through the thick fog, their path lit only by their own arcane lights and the faint luminescence of the bioluminescent fungi that dotted the landscape. The town of Barovia soon emerged from the gloom, a dark silhouette against the dimly lit, mist-shrouded sky. As they entered the village, the quiet was unsettling. The usually bustling streets were desolate, with only a few stray cats or dogs milling about. The town, already naturally quiet and wary, seemed to be in a state of silent anticipation, a stark contrast to the chaos they had left behind in the mountain. They made their way to the burgomaster's mansion, the grandest building in Barovia. Its stone walls and slate roof were a greyish blur against the monochrome backdrop. As they approached, the burgomaster's weary eyes peered out from a slit in the door, barely visible in the dim light. His surprised expression was evident, even in the gloom, as the party, against all odds, had returned.*
Tavoros BOT 18-06-2023 08:42
Tavoros steps up and knocks loudly on the door once more. It feels like only a moment since they were last here, but in that time so much has happened.
Narrator BOT 18-06-2023 12:40
In response to his knock, the slit in the door slid open once more, revealing the weary eyes of the burgomaster. There was a moment of stunned silence as the burgomaster took in the sight of the battle-worn party. Then, without a word, he disappeared from the slit. A moment later, the door creaked open, revealing the burgomaster in the faint light of the entryway. His face was a study in astonishment and relief. The party had returned, beaten and battered, but triumphant. He spreads his arms in a welcoming gesture and breaks into a tired smile.
Ismark Kolyanovich BOT 18-06-2023 12:40
"By the Morninglord," he says in a voice filled with disbelief and gratitude, "you've returned! And alive at that! I had feared the worst when so much time had passed... but you've defied the odds yet again. Welcome back, brave ones. Please, come in. You must be eager to rest, and we are eager to hear your tales. And... perhaps we can find some way to properly celebrate your victory, even amidst this unending gloom."
Liliana BOT 18-06-2023 13:09
"Uh-huh, sure. So, what's up with the funeral ambience anyway?" She walks in, making room for the others to follow "Did something happen while we were digging around?"
Orion BOT 18-06-2023 13:16
accepts the invitation into the home, and finds a cozy place to sit.
Tavoros BOT 18-06-2023 13:50
"Excuse me sir" Tavoros starts as he sits down, "but I do not think the gloom is unending. Or rather, it only is if you choose to feel that way." "There are other choices. We are alive after all, and life is what you make of it." He says this with a genuine smile on his face.
Ismark Kolyanovich BOT 18-06-2023 14:00
Looking to Liliana he says. "The gloom and sorrow are as much a part of Barovia as the cobblestones beneath our feet, my dear. It's a heavy burden we Barovians bear." Then turning to Tavoros, the Burgomaster's stern face softens, and he gives a small, appreciative nod. "Your optimism is a breath of fresh air, Master Tavoros. Despite the darkness that shrouds our land, we must remember that we are indeed alive. And that life... it's a gift. We must make the best of it, no matter our circumstances. Thank you for reminding me."
Liliana BOT 18-06-2023 14:02
Liliana almost makes another snarky remark, but realises in time that calling the Burgomaster out on the edge would be a bit of a 'pot calling the kettle black' situation. Instead she shrugs "At any rate, job's done. Honestly, it was good foresight to send us out there, because otherwise we all might have had a big, winged and scaled problem on our hands, plus two smaller but also winged and scaled ones"
Laurentina (Full Moon Phase) BOT 18-06-2023 15:13
stands behind Lili not sure if she should help or chime in "Uhm Yes, Lili took it down almost single handedly!"
